programme.desc: Dr Rana Mistry fails to show up for work, leaving receptionist Joanna struggling to deal with a room full of angry patients. Medical drama, starring Sarah Manners

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The dodgy dealer agrees to help Charlotte's friend Mary Gladden save a nursing home by valuing and selling its antiques - only to find himself in the line of fire as someone makes an attempt on his life. Drama, starring Ian McShane, Dudley Sutton, Caroline Langrishe and Susan Fleetwood

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: A wild weekend away in the remote Derbyshire countryside turns into chaos when an Army helicopter crashes, unearthing horrifying memories of the Balkan conflict for Alex and Claire, who race to save the casualties. Back at the surgery, new recruit Matt struggles to hold the fort, unsure what to do about a boy suffering with breathing difficulties. Rural medical drama, starring Maggie O'Neill and Eva Pope

programme.title: The Upper Hand
programme.desc: Caroline prepares dinner for a friend, but her plans go to waste when he finds himself stuck in Brussels. Joe McGann stars

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: The Germans celebrate the burning of the Reichstag with a little Bavarian dancing, while Rene breaks into Herr Flick's lair and the British airmen attempt to cross the channel by rowing boat

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: The trio scheme to get Wally out from under Nora Batty's thumb for a day, but come a cropper sneaking him back to the house. Comedy, starring Bill Owen and Joe Gladwin

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: The trio stumble across a health farm on a day out, leading Foggy to devise an ingenious money-making scam - selling food to its famished inhabitants. Comedy, starring Brian Wilde

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The detectives are called out to a robbery where a security guard is found dead. As they try to determine whether his demise was an accident or murder, they expose a complex web of deception among his friends - or enemies. Meanwhile, Lateef uncovers evidence of an international exchange racket. Art Malik guest stars

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: An unknown tagger begins to paint graffiti around London, and claims to have been responsible for killing a celebrated street artist four years previously. Originally part of a gang, the victim went solo after receiving support from a wealthy art patron, and when the detectives reopen the case, they become suspicious of his resentful former crew members. Meanwhile, Brian signs up to a social networking site as TopCop999 to chart the gritty life of a lawman, much to his colleagues' displeasure

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: The murder of Amir Aziz, a prominent anti-fundamentalist Muslim, drags the Lyell team into the murky world of hate-crime and counter-terrorism. Initially thought to be the work of a EDL member whose son was killed by the Taliban, the team begin to suspect the killing is connected to Sarah Begovic, a young woman who left the UK to relocate to Syria, but who recently returned home in secret with her six-month-old son. Feature-length episode of the crime drama, starring Richard Lintern

programme.title: Detectorists
programme.desc: Terry is expecting a big turnout for the DMDC's annual rally, but it remains to be seen whether the day will bring heartache or triumph for Andy and Lance

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Mac enrols the team at the local gym, while Anoushka and Joanna vie for the attentions of pop singer Gavin _ who has his eyes on another member of the practice altogether

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Dr Rawlings rejects Anoushka's advances, and she ends up pouring her heart out to Dr Rana Mistry _ who lends her more than just a sympathetic ear. Meanwhile, a lonely man finds solace within the confines of Riverside medical centre

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: The enforcement of the no-referrals policy means that a dangerously ill patient has to be taken to another hospital but, with no ambulances available, Michael decides on drastic action to ensure their arrival, something that has devastating consequences. A recovering alcoholic is the primary candidate for a liver transplant, which initially fails to impress Serena, but she later clashes with Ric when it appears that her patient is not considered a suitable recipient. Jonny tells Mo he cannot attend her family get-together because of his auntie's birthday, but the disappointment she feels at the time turns to fury when his attempts to fix her up with a fellow doctor come to light. Medical drama, starring Hari Dhillon, Catherine Russell, Hugh Quarshie, Michael Thomson and Chizzy Akudolu

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Kelly feels the pressure and social worker Trish Barnes investigates allegations of child abuse. Hospital drama, starring Derek Thompson

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Brandon Kane blames Honey Harman for the fire that burnt down his house, and despite her protestations, it looks like their friendship is beyond repair - and to add insult to injury, Cathy Bradford delights in making her rival paranoid about the disaster. Adam Okaro is desperate to put away the teenage thugs who caused Yvonne Hemmingway's injuries, but his heavy-handed tactics lead to a riot

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Sam is put in charge of the Mitchell family businesses. She's determined to show how capable she is and lays down the law to Den

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Den and Dennis hatch a plan to convince Kate that Phil's guilty. Kate falls for it, and she also falls for Dennis's charms

programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: Henry is enlisted in the search for a missing policeman, but the restaurant's opening night is looming. Detective drama, starring Richard Griffiths and Maggie Steed

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Lovejoy finds an unusual Ming Dynasty war cannon being used as a plant pot. His client asks him to get the best price for the item - but the Chinese community objects to any such proposed deal in no uncertain terms and when Charlotte takes the dodgy dealer to London to sell it they are abducted. Burt Kwouk guest stars, with Ian McShane

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Leanne is raped and left for dead, a trauma that sends the whole community into shock _ especially Tom, who is the one to find her. However, life goes on in Cardale, as Will offers a grovelling apology to sacked receptionist Carol, while Matt and Shaun step up their rivalry on the football field _ but it remains to be seen if Kerri will be impressed by their childish efforts to win her affection. Medical drama, starring Simon Shepherd and Christabel Fellowes

programme.title: The Upper Hand
programme.desc: An old friend visits Caroline and finds Charlie attractive. Comedy, starring Diana Weston and Joe McGann

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: Presuming Rene is dead, Edith hunts for his will and a new husband. Meanwhile, the airmen pose as nuns and Herr Flick enlists Lt Gruber's artistic expertise in distinguishing a real painting from two forgeries. Second World War comedy, starring Gorden Kaye

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Clegg agrees to drive Ludovic's newly acquired van home for him, but finds the vehicle rather worse for wear. Rural comedy, starring Peter Sallis and Bryan Pringle

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Compo, Clegg and Foggy put their unique talents to good use in the church concert, but only one of them has his heart set on ensuring the venture is a success. Comedy, starring Bill Owen, Peter Sallis and Brian Wilde

programme.title: Kingdom
programme.desc: Philandering lawyer Judge Harding (guest star Jack Dee) is convinced he is being blackmailed by a mystery woman out to destroy his reputation and turns to Kingdom for help. But as Peter gets to know Harding, he faces the repercussions of the man's past relationship with Beatrice. Meanwhile, Lyle tries to mediate in a land dispute between golfers and druids. Stephen Fry, Hermione Norris and Karl Davies star

programme.title: Maisie Raine
programme.desc: Maisie investigates a fire-bombing at the home of a former policeman who suspects he's being targeted by an ex-convict, and Tomlin receives a series of obscene phone calls from someone who always knows when she's alone. Pauline Quirke and Rakie Ayola star

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: When a retrospective exhibition of murdered fashion designer Ritchie Levene's work opens, the team is prompted to re-examine the three-year-old crime. The detectives learn about his tempestuous relationships with his new spouse, personal assistant and ex-wife Sarah, who believes his brother Adrian is the killer because he had the most to gain from his death. Meanwhile, Gerry enlists Emily to help update his image, although not everyone is impressed with the results. Crime drama, guest starring Rupert Graves and Hannah Waterman

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: An ex-convict is found murdered in his home and suspicion immediately lands on a recently released child killer. Nikki and the Lyell team are introduced to forensic psychologist Sasha Blackburn, who works closely with those released from prison on licence, as both the victim and one of the suspects are clients of hers. The investigators soon learn that it is not just the minds of these young men that are fragile, but their freedom is too. Feature-length episode of the crime drama, guest starring Lyndsey Marshal and Niamh Cusack

programme.title: Detectorists
programme.desc: Lance has failed to detect even so much as a ring-pull in months, leaving Russell to suspect he has been cursed. Seasonal episode of the comedy from 2015, starring Mackenzie Crook, Toby Jones and Pearce Quigley

programme.desc: The enforcement of the no-referrals policy means that a dangerously ill patient has to be taken to another hospital but, with no ambulances available, Michael decides on drastic action to ensure their arrival, something that has devastating consequences. Meanwhile, back at the restaurant, Sally is harassed by a finicky diner. Richard Griffiths stars

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Caroline receives an unusual offer from a determined lady stricken with cancer. Meanwhile, Rana finds himself on the wrong side of the law. Jacqueline Leonard stars

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Helen searches for an answer to a child's hyperactivity, while Mac is forced into a strike situation at a factory. Medical drama series set in a busy Midlands practice, starring Christopher Timothy

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Mo and Jac are divided over a medical dilemma involving a Jehovah's Witness who insists on having a bloodless operation - but it soon becomes clear that is not the only problem between them. Hanssen has closed the non-referral scheme following the death of Michael's taxi patient and wants answers from everyone involved - will Michael accept his role or stand up for what he believes to be the truth? Meanwhile, Chrissie feels guilty for her part in the tragedy and overcompensates in her care of another patient

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Duffy is wracked with guilt following Kelly's suicide, and a test-drive in a flash car has disastrous consequences

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Adam Okaro goes back on the frontline, where his time with Tony Stamp teaches him much about the pressures his officers face on a daily basis. Phil is placed in a difficult situation when Christine Weaver gets arrested for shoplifting and Gina Gold's duties as a senior officer are tested to the limit when Sheelagh Murphy goes into labour out in the field

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Alfie has a rough day. First, he upsets his cousin Maxwell and then his wife turns up and informs him that they're still married!

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Derek's excited about meeting his daughter, but things turn sour when she gets cold feet

programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: A surveillance team is sent into the restaurant to catch one of Henry's regulars in the act of bribing an MP. Drama, starring Richard Griffiths

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: When faced with a hefty dentist bill, Lovejoy agrees to settle it by investigating the alleged death by drowning of Terence Sullivan, a fellow antiques dealer. It doesn't take long to determine that Sullivan is still alive, having taken up residence with an attractive stewardess. When Charlotte sees Lovejoy's caring side towards the 'widow', she feels she may have misjudged his character and finally gives in to his seductive charm. Pete Postlethwaite guest stars, with Ian McShane

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Tom takes the law into his own hands to nail the man who assaulted Leanne, incensed by the police's apparent reluctance to prosecute anyone. Kate grows increasingly frustrated by Will's mood swings and seeks comfort in the arms of James Strickland, while Alex makes a wild allegation to put a stop to Claire's advances toward her. Medical drama, starring Gray O'Brien and Simon Shepherd

programme.title: The Upper Hand
programme.desc: Caroline disapproves of Charlie's attitude towards the children's fighting, but a traumatic day in which Tom also gets into trouble forces her to eat her words. Comedy, starring Joe McGann and Diana Weston

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: The British airmen are forced to return to their hideout at Rene's cafe following a bungled escape attempt, and Edith continues to search for a new husband. Gorden Kaye and Carmen Silvera star

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Foggy's experiments with camouflage only succeed in frightening innocent passers-by. Brian Wilde stars in Roy Clarke's long-running comedy

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Wesley discovers an old racing car, which Compo, Clegg and Foggy offer to help him transport back to his shed, not reckoning on its condition. Long-running rural comedy, starring Bill Owen, Peter Sallis and Brian Wilde, with Gordon Wharmby

programme.title: Shakespeare & Hathaway: Private Investigators
programme.desc: When a pampered dog runs away from a life of luxury, Frank and Lu are asked to track it down. Comedy drama, starring Mark Benton and Jo Joyner

programme.title: Shakespeare & Hathaway: Private Investigators
programme.desc: When a role-playing battle in the woods goes wrong, Lu and Frank must clear the queen's name and catch the culprit. Starring Mark Benton and Jo Joyner

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team reopens the case of criminal Mark Johnson, who was killed in a fire at London's Union club in 1996. The original investigation was hampered by silence among witnesses and associates, but with new information suggesting the blaze was a targeted arson attack, the detectives hope they will have more success. Drama, guest starring Roy Marsden, Martin Marquez and Tom Watt

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: The accidental fatal shooting of a Polish teenager in an armed police operation sparks a series of murders, which links Turkish gangsters, a grieving family and a fractured firearms unit. As the inquest delivers a lawful killings verdict, IPCC investigator Rachel Sharpe calls on the Lyell team to investigate the connection between the events and review the police evidence, but Sharpe's relationship with the family of the teenager and her suspicion of the firearms division lead Nikki and Thomas to distrust her motives. Feature-length episode, starring Emilia Fox

programme.title: Detectorists
programme.desc: Andy is living with his mother-in-law, Lance's flat is not his own any more and the dark cloud of a solar farm threatens the gang's tranquillity. Comedy, starring Mackenzie Crook and Toby Jones

Next in is Alejandro with his Great Grandmother's breadcrumb maker that is over 100-years-old and has been passed through generations of his family. Years of use has left the machine unusable but with any luck, metal expert Dominic Chinea will be able to bring it back to life. programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and the experts get to work on more heirlooms to bring them, and the memories they hold, back to life. Dominic Chinea faces the heavy-duty task of repairing a seized-up retro roundabout that reminds its owner Stella of her three daughters' childhoods. Wood expert Will Kirk is amazed when a First World War dominoes set, thought to have been played in the Christmas truce of 1914, arrives in the barn. Suzie Fletcher uses her leather skills on a 19th-century women's side saddle bought in Texas, and Julie and Amanda need the help of mechanical maestro Steve Fletcher to fix a broken teddy bear

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Strictly Come Dancing stars Anton Du Beke, Katya Jones and Graziano Di Prima join Nick Knowles and the team in Wallsend, Newcastle. Together, they set to work transforming the True Colours performing arts school, an inclusive dance school that teaches dance and theatre skills to 500 children and young adults weekly, many of whom have disabilities and learning needs. The school has grown substantially over time and they've completely outgrown their existing space, so the team get to work renovating a run-down old boys club that would give the dance school the extra space it so desperately needs to continue to transform more young lives

programme.title: Ambulance
programme.desc: The first of two strike days affecting ambulance services across the country begins - the most widescale industrial action for a generation. North West Ambulance Service loses over a third of its workforce as staff join the picket lines to object over pay, working conditions and their concerns for patient safety. With limited resources, the service will only be responding to category one and two calls - the most life-threatening - and lesser category calls will not be sent an ambulance. Narrated by Christopher Eccleston

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Lee Mack researches his family tree, delving into the life of his great-grandfather and fellow comedian Billy. Not long into his journey, the Not Going Out star discovers that his relative was passionate about more than making people laugh as Billy joined the first-ever Pals Battalion in Liverpool at the start of the First World War and honed his act at the front lines in the Battle of the Somme. Lee also looks into the upbringing of his maternal grandfather Joe, who was deserted by his unwed mother

The celebrities need to deliver on the techniques, flavours and love that go into these dishes in order to impress Big Zuu and judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace. The celebrity who outshines the rest will earn a pass straight through to the next round. The remaining six must cook off and make a plate of food that evokes a special time and place in their lives

As Aiden treats the person, another job comes in for a two-year-old who has fallen from a balcony. programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Experts Kate Bliss and Tim Weeks are on hand as two teams go head to head at an antiques fair in Builth Wells, Brecknockshire, searching for bargains to sell for profit at auction. Host Charlie Ross also visits a grand hall built in the early 1880s, now a museum, but once the local courtroom with accommodation for the judge in residence, all under one roof

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Amur tigers are the largest of the species and are part of a vital international breeding programme. For this reason that Rusty must leave the park as he has been selected to move to Blackpool Zoo, where he will hopefully become father to cubs of his own. Plus, the parrots have a dance-off. Presented by Ben Fogle, Kate Humble, Hamza Yassin and Megan McCubbin

programme.title: Expert Witness
programme.desc: Police turn to a facial reconstruction expert to help identify a dismembered body, and a cell site expert uses his tracking skills to catch killers in Northern Ireland

programme.title: Robson Green's Weekend Escapes
programme.desc: The actor explores the north-east of England in the company of family and famous friends, showcasing the region's natural beauty and the important role it plays in relieving stress and supporting mental health. Joining him on the first edition is former Newcastle United striker Les Ferdinand, with the pair beginning by travelling from Bamburgh to Seahouses on e-bikes

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Rachel Burden takes viewers' calls on the day's talking points, hearing views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 (calls are free from mobiles and landlines)

programme.desc: Tanya Arnold introduces action from the latest Super League matches. including Catalans Dragons v Wigan Warriors and St Helens v Castleford Tigers

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win 10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Make Me a Dealer
programme.desc: Paul Martin takes on raw recruits and sets them on the road to being successful antiques dealers. Here, Dorset mother-of-two Lucia Foster-Found takes on chef Alex Koerber. Which of the two will triumph at the nail-biting boardroom finale?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chefs compete to cook a fish course worthy of serving at a banquet celebrating the brilliance of British popular music, held at Abbey Road Studios. Along with the show's panel of judges, the rivals need to impress guest Kanya King - a key player in Britain's music industry

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: Footage of animals that have unusual means of finding their way around. Dung beetles are able to navigate by the sky, using the position of the sun, moon and stars to determine which is the right direction to go in, while pigeons display remarkable powers of memory, able to recall complex travel routes and follow manmade roads and hedgerows

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: In Blackburn, Michael Portillo catches a rare glimpse of Edwardian life on celluloid and marvels at how factory workers and schoolchildren alike were drawn to seek fame on film. Continuing east to Nelson, Michael braves the enemy camp to have a pint of tea with the socialist working classes in Britain's last Clarion House

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin and the team value antiques in Longleat, Wiltshire, where experts Claire Rawle and Michael Baggott pick out a selection of interesting collectibles to be sold at auction, including an amethyst and pearl brooch and an autograph album featuring a set of Beatles' signatures - but their authenticity keeps the experts guessing. The presenter also uncovers the hidden architectural gems of one of Wiltshire's most famous sons, Christopher Wren, during a trip to London

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Jennie McAlpine, Ugo Monye, Joe Pasquale and Felicity Ward test their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week, with a winner declared on Friday

programme.title: Marcus Wareing's Tales from a Kitchen Garden
programme.desc: Marcus and gardener Anatoliy decide they need some advice on bee keeping after the bees mysteriously disappeared from the garden last year. The pair travel to The Newt to meet Paula for some tips. Marcus plants some pollinating flowers while Anatoliy picks some homegrown gooseberries for pickling

programme.title: Coastal Defenders
programme.desc: The dive team are called out to Brighton Marina's main jetty which is on a tilt, and at low tide threatens to fall on young diver Kai's head. Also, an oil tanker the size of two football pitches is given an inch-by-inch inspection before it is allowed to set sail

programme.title: This Farming Life
programme.desc: Return of the documentary following life on farms around Scotland, beginning as the autumn sales are over and preparations are being made for winter. In Newtonmore in Cairngorms National Park, Robert MacKenzie needs to gather in all his cows back down to the croft for pregnancy testing, while on North Uist, the MacDonalds are harvesting potatoes grown in the sandy machair soil unique to the west of Scotland

programme.title: Ultimate Wedding Planner
programme.desc: Sparks fly as the contenders clash over plans for a multi-themed wedding, and with two venues to arrange it turns out to be the toughest challenge yet. Can they pull together and impress judges Sara Davies, Fred Sirieix and Raj Somaiya?

programme.title: Henpocalypse!
programme.desc: Mother-of-the bride Bernadette outlines an outrageous plan to improve post-apocalyptic life for everyone, but faces opposition. Shelly tries to make amends for her past mistakes. Comedy, starring Lucie Shorthouse, Elizabeth Berrington, Callie Cooke, Lauren O'Rourke and Kate O'Flynn

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events with Faisal Islam

programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: In the Heat of the Night (1967)
programme.desc: When a wealthy industrialist is murdered in Mississippi, the bigoted local sheriff is quick to accuse a black newcomer to town - only to learn his suspect is a highly respected homicide detective from Philadelphia. However, the duo are forced to put aside their mutual loathing and team up to track down the killer. Oscar-winning drama, starring Sidney Poitier, Rod Steiger and Warren Oates

programme.title: Couples Therapy
programme.desc: Brock and Kristi return from a blissful vacation only to be crushed by reality. Orna has a breakthrough with Sean. Josh and Natasha make a surprising turn

programme.title: Ultimate Wedding Planner
programme.desc: It comes down to the wire as the planners battle to impress the judges and pull off a millionaire's garden party for Lauren and Jodie

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles is in Kingston in Surrey, where the teams are led by Thomas Forrester and Gary Pe. While the competition hots up, Eric gets on his bike at the Herne Hill Velodrome

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore visits Keynsham recycling centre where she finds an assortment of bed linens for designer Zoe Murphy, a pair of chairs for upholsterer Simion Hawtin-Smith and a large collection of dog ornaments for her to upcycle and sell on

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo has reached Lincolnshire, where his coastal railway journey from Middlesbrough ends. In Grimsby Town, he investigates a new stage in the town's history - as a maintenance base for some of the largest wind farms in the world. In neighbouring Cleethorpes, Michael rides on the Cleethorpes Coast Light Railway, pulled by a miniature steam locomotive. Later, Michael makes for a curious and wild stretch of coastline at Humberston

programme.title: Our Lives
programme.desc: After suffering some traumatic events in his life, ex-Royal Air Force aircraft engineer Simon Parker needed a change, so left the mainland to begin a new life as the warden of Flatholm Island. Four miles from Cardiff, in the middle of the Bristol Channel, Flatholm has no mains power or water and is exposed to the worst of the weather. It is a site of special scientific interest because of its gull colony, which makes up 20 per cent of the Welsh gull population and is a crucial breeding ground. As this programme reveals, the more Simon learns about the remote location, the more he learns about himself

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Rachel Burden takes viewers' calls on the day's talking points, hearing views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 (calls are free from mobiles and landlines)

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win 10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Make Me a Dealer
programme.desc: Paul Martin shows a cattery owner and a handyman from Clevedon the tricks of the trade for buying and selling collectibles, before an auction showdown

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The eight regional champions compete to get their main courses onto the final menu of the banquet at Abbey Road Studios. They will be cooking for the regular judges - food critic Mathew Fort, cook and broadcaster Andi Oliver and restaurateur Oliver Peyton - plus the guest judge, former Wham! star Andrew Ridgeley

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: The naturalist explores the extremes of birth in the animal kingdom, explaining why the giant panda gives birth to the smallest babies of any existing mammal. He also looks at the kiwi, asking why the bird produces a single egg that is a quarter of its body mass - one of the largest in the world - and almost too big to lay

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo visits Heaton Park in Manchester, where one of the first open air concerts was held in 1909, before travelling on to the town of Oldham. Michael then ventures to Edale in the Peak District, where he joins ramblers in walking country, and learns how a Sheffield socialist spearheaded a mass trespassing revolt to open up the countryside to working people

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin and the team visit Layer Marney Tower in rural Essex, where antiques experts Elizabeth Talbot and Philip Serrell examine items brought in by members of the public, including a Clarice Cliff coffee set and a bronze model of an Alsatian dog. Paul goes in search of the Witchfinder General, one of the county's most notorious characters and also heads to the 1.3-mile long Southend Pier

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Jennie McAlpine, Ugo Monye, Joe Pasquale and Felicity Ward test their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week, with a winner declared on Friday

programme.title: Marcus Wareing's Tales from a Kitchen Garden
programme.desc: The Michelin-starred chef learns how to grow potatoes, with help from local farmer Steve, and heads out to sea to catch some mackerel to go with them. After helping farmer Stuart feed his cattle, who are running out of grass due to the very dry weather, Marcus grills his mackerel and serves it with roasted potatoes for him and Stuart to enjoy

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc: Archaeologist Ben Robinson reveals how some of the nation's best-loved villages played a vital part in significant moments of history. He begins in Bamburgh in Northumberland, explaining how the health and fortunes of the village were shaped by those in charge of its famous castle, from early English kings to 18th-century philanthropists, who pioneered a welfare system nearly 200 years before one existed nationally. Ben visits fellow archaeologist Jessica Turner, whose findings show the seventh-century residents of Bamburgh were robust and healthy - contrary to the usual malnourishment of the British medieval population

programme.title: Sir Simon Rattle at the Proms
programme.desc: The conductor takes to the Royal Albert Hall stage for his final UK performance as music director of the London Symphony Orchestra. Together, this renowned and dynamic partnership poignantly mark the end of an era with Mahler's epic, all-encompassing Symphony - his Ninth. Known as the 'farewell symphony', it is shrouded in loss, complete with a dazzling spectrum of joy and despair, and ending in tranquillity and stillness. Katie Derham presents

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts a specially spooky episode of the quiz, with David Mitchell, Richard Osman, Zoe Lyons and Alan Davies

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: In the second of two special episodes commemorating the end of the long-running topical comedy series, a chance to see again some of the finest moments from the second half of its 17-year history

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories. With Faisal Islam

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: International T20 Cricket
programme.desc: England v New Zealand. Action from the first match in a four-game series, held at The Seat Unique Riverside in Chester-le-Street, County Durham

programme.title: Crazy Rich Agents: Selling Dream Homes
programme.desc: In Manhattan, Mike is at a luxurious 5million property he's hoping to sell to a top music producer, while Georgie hopes she can finally get her first sale. In New York City, the top two rookies are invited to the agency's yearly summit, where they have to make an impromptu speech in front of 200 brokers. After this toe-curling experience, they meet two of CEO Eddie's top performing brokers who grill them to see them if they've really got what it takes to make it in the Big Apple

programme.title: This Farming Life
programme.desc: Return of the documentary following life on farms around Scotland, beginning as the autumn sales are over and preparations are being made for winter. In Newtonmore in Cairngorms National Park, Robert MacKenzie needs to gather in all his cows back down to the croft for pregnancy testing, while on North Uist, the MacDonalds are harvesting potatoes grown in the sandy machair soil unique to the west of Scotland

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: The celebrities are put into pairs and tasked with cooking a crowd-pleasing dish which must be identical in both appearance and flavour but only one team member has the instructions and must communicate to get the job done. Then, it's out of the frying pan and into the fire as the contestants cook in a professional kitchen for paying customers during a busy lunchtime service for the first time in three years. Finally, in the all-new Food Truck Challenge the celebrities cook a dish they would serve from their own dream food truck in just one hour

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: The three remaining celebrities must cook a faultless two-course meal that will not only be judged by John Torode and Gregg Wallace, but also John Partridge (series champion 2018), Judi Love (Christmas champion 2021), and 2022 finalist Melanie Blatt. All three know what it takes to get through this competition, and tonight they are in for a treat as the contenders pull out all the stops to secure their semi-final place

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph visits Beaconsfield recycling centre where she finds a pile of discarded drawers for the attention of woodworker Kris Mutter, a potentially lucrative antique chair for furniture restorer Katie Keat and a drop-leaf table she plans to revamp

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson helps a couple to find a new home in Moray, and chats to residents of a village recognised as a world leader for sustainable and holistic community living

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect
programme.desc: Retired couple Liz and Paul from Norwich reach out to Angela Scanlon for help redesigning their three-bed home that has become unmanageable for Liz who has a degenerative bone disease. Architects Lynsey Elliott and Damion Burrows create their own designs to make the home perfect for the couple and allow them to see what it would look like using virtual reality and visual effects to help them decide which one to choose. Lynsey blows the pair away with her wedge-shaped extension but Damion's joyous bright colour scheme brings Paul to tears

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Rachel Burden takes viewers' calls on the day's talking points, hearing views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 (calls are free from mobiles and landlines)

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win 10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Make Me a Dealer
programme.desc: Paul Martin shows a businessman and a reprographic manager from Norfolk the tricks of the trade for buying and selling collectibles, before an auction showdown

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the last chance for the finalists to get a dish in contention for the banquet and the chefs are going all out as they serve their dessert course, with tributes to acts as diverse as Shirley Bassey and Wham!, Former New Order and Joy Division bass player Peter Hook helps judge the puddings, before the final menu to be served at Abbey Road Studios is selected

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: The naturalist investigates whether animals and plants have developed an awareness of mathematics, including bamboos that flower exactly the same around the world. Plus, the story of a German horse named Hans that was declared a mathematical genius, but all was not as it seemed

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo journeys from Maltby to Hinckley, going whippet racing and trying to understand the appeal of Marmite, before a look around the Triumph motorcycle factory

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin presents from the Highcliffe Castle in Dorset, a 19th century castle that has been restored using all kinds of ingenious methods

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Jennie McAlpine, Ugo Monye, Joe Pasquale and Felicity Ward test their general knowledge skills in the penultimate series of challenges

programme.title: Marcus Wareing's Tales from a Kitchen Garden
programme.desc: The chef rediscovers some wasabi plants in his kitchen garden, and decides to find out more, including how to grow them at the UK's only wasabi farm. Back on home turf, Marcus checks on his ducks and gathers up a glut of lavender to take to local gelato-maker, Grant

programme.title: Live Athletics
programme.desc: The Weltklasse Zurich. Coverage of the 11th meeting of the campaign, held at Letzigrund in Switzerland. Many of the stars of the recent World Championships are expected to be in action, and it was two of the planet's leading sprinters who took the headlines last year, with Noah Lyles winning the men's 200m in a meeting record of 19.52 second and Shelly-Ann Fraser-Pryce equalling the mark of 10.65 set by Elaine Thompson-Herah a year earlier in the women's 100m

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With autumn just around the corner, Adam Frost takes stock of his garden and plans ahead for some late-season interest under the supervision of Ash the cat. Frances Tophill visits a garden in Kent where the plants provide a non-stop buffet for insects, while Nick Bailey travels to Cornwall to revel in the glory of hardy palms

programme.title: No Activity
programme.desc: Hendy and Stokes are joined on their stakeout by a witness, in the hope that she can identify a suspect. Nearby, Bruce and Jimmy are reunited as Bruce is released from hospital in much better health than expected. April gets to meet Lachy for the first time after Carol brings him to work

programme.title: Laugh Lessons
programme.desc: Fats Timbo, a model, dancer and content creator, reveals what life as a 4ft woman is really like

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events with Kirsty Wark

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Couples Therapy
programme.desc: Christine learns what's hiding underneath her resentment. Erica connects with Sean. Brock and Kristi reach a potential breaking point

programme.title: Ultimate Wedding Planner
programme.desc: Sparks fly as the contenders clash over plans for a multi-themed wedding, and with two venues to arrange it turns out to be the toughest challenge yet. Can they pull together and impress judges Sara Davies, Fred Sirieix and Raj Somaiya?

programme.title: T20 Cricket
programme.desc: Action from the first in the three-match series, held at the 1st Central County Ground in Hove

programme.title: Coastal Defenders
programme.desc: The Dive team are called out to Brighton Marina's main jetty which is on a tilt, combined with the low tide it threatens to fall down on young diver Kai's head. Plus, an oil tanker the size of two football pitches is inspected inch by inch before it's allowed to set sail

programme.title: The Hidden World of Hospitality with Tom Kerridge
programme.desc: The chef turns his attention to street food which is experiencing a boom when the industry is struggling. In the West Midlands, Tom meets Jack Brabant and James Swinburne, founders of an expanding street food collective called Digbeth Dining Club. They curate street food events and venues, bringing together the best independent local traders with DJs and live music to create a new kind of dining experience

programme.title: Crazy Rich Agents: Selling Dream Homes
programme.desc: Georgie assures her fellow brokers that she has clients who are interested in a beautiful country house, but where does it leave her when the potential buyers don't even show up? Vanesa didn't get any offers from her open house in Monaco and is now worried that her mother is going to cut her off, while Krish is not convinced about working in London and meets up with an old contact from Leicester. The millionaire entrepreneur is looking for a new family home, but he has a very specific list of criteria and is refusing to share exactly what they are with Krish

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Secret Life of Farm Animals
programme.desc: Documentary examining the behaviour of farm animals, testing their intelligence, discovering unlikely relationships and uncovering a side to them that may never have been seen before. The first film focuses on sheep, following 12 weeks in the life of a lamb on a Welsh hill farm, and revealing them to be highly sociable with a remarkable ability to recognise each other and human faces too. Other animals featured include a lonely goose looking for company and a piglet that thinks it is a cow

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo heads from Newcastle to Lynemouth, and is intrigued to hear of its part in Newcastle's early industrial development. En route, Michael travels through the huge Northumberland coalfield and, at Cramlington, he alights to visit an extraordinary work of landform art made from the spoil of a coalmine, the vast Northumberlandia, known as the Lady of the North

programme.title: Some Mothers Do 'Ave 'Em
programme.desc: Frank survives an accident-prone journey to see Betty in hospital - and the medical staff soon find themselves wishing he'd arrived as a patient rather than a visitor. Michael Crawford, Michele Dotrice and Elisabeth Sladen star

programme.title: Yes Minister
programme.desc: Hacker is challenged to convince Sir Humphrey that a computer holding vital citizen information could raise concerns about people's rights to privacy. Paul Eddington and Nigel Hawthorne star

programme.title: The Thick of It
programme.desc: Shadow minister Peter Mannion is due to visit to check out the department before the general election - which is yet another distraction for Nicola on a day when nothing seems to be going right. However, while trying to force Glenn and Olly to kick-start her new initiative, she receives an important call. Political comedy, with Rebecca Front and guest star Roger Allam

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: With AI permeating every aspect of modern life, storyville investigates the limits of Artificial Intelligence, how it is changing the world and the true extent of its consequences

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: Using clips from the science strand's archive, this film examines how people have learnt to live with new emerging technology of the time, and how artificial intelligence systems power our daily lives

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: Exploring the artificial intelligence required to replace human drivers, focusing on issues including the ethics of driverless car crashes and the impact on jobs. Despite the glossy PR and positives such as reduced exhaust emissions, the reality is that the future of driverless cars might not be all good news

programme.title: Berlin 1945
programme.desc: Life in the German capital in the year the Second World War ended, told through the stories of those who experienced it - from ordinary Germans to the Allied forces who entered the city. In the final episode, the British, French and Americans troop wait to enter Berlin, while members of the Jewish community, among whom there are few survivors, regroup

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo heads from Newcastle to Lynemouth, and is intrigued to hear of its part in Newcastle's early industrial development. En route, Michael travels through the huge Northumberland coalfield and, at Cramlington, he alights to visit an extraordinary work of landform art made from the spoil of a coalmine, the vast Northumberlandia, known as the Lady of the North

programme.title: Oceans Apart: Art and the Pacific with James Fox
programme.desc: Continuing his exploration of the collision of the West and Pacific culture, art historian Dr James Fox looks at how the West has created a vision of Polynesia as paradise. He travels across the Pacific to uncover the great sites and masterpieces of pre-contact Polynesian art, from the massive religious complex Taputapuatea on the island of Raiatea to the extraordinary feathered Ku heads from Hawaii, testament to the rich and sophisticated societies that once lived there

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo explores the wild and rugged coastline of Northumberland by rail, beginning in Morpeth, where he finds an historic collection of Northumbrian bagpipes and discovers how difficult they are to play. The East Coast mainline delivers Michael to Widdrington and its long sandy bay, where a beachcombing blacksmith finds treasures to inspire artwork in steel

programme.title: Climbing Great Buildings
programme.desc: Architectural historian Jonathan Foyle heads for Caernarfon Castle in north Wales. Built in 1283, its architecture revolutionised the way fortresses were constructed in Britain, and its decorations were inspired by the city of Constantinople when it was under Roman rule. Assisted by climber Lucy Creamer, the presenter scales over 100 ft up the majestic Eagle tower before abseiling down the King's Gate to investigate the super-fortified main entrance

programme.title: Meet the Romans with Mary Beard
programme.desc: The professor delves deeper into ordinary Roman life by going behind the closed doors of the family home. She tells the stories of eccentric wife Glyconis - praised by her husband for liking a drink or two - Allia Potestas, who lived in a menage a trois, and 11-year-old schoolboy Sulpicius Maximus, worked to death by his pushy parents. Mary also paints a more detailed picture of slavery, revealing that many Romans chose to be buried with their servants

programme.title: Colosseum
programme.desc: Ignatius refuses to pledge his allegiance to the emperor and for this crime he is forced to travel 1,800 miles in chains and mostly on foot from Antioch to Rome, where awaits his final punishment at The Colosseum. Drama-documentary that uses the Colosseum to tell the thrilling story of the rise and fall of the Roman Empire. Anthony Barclay stars

programme.title: Colosseum
programme.desc: Drama-documentary telling the story of the Roman Empire. Scientist Galen of Pergamon makes a name for himself as a physician for gladiators in the arena. A devastating plague sweeps through the city and Galen catches the attention of Emperor Marcus Aurelius. Narrated by Campbell Scott

programme.title: I, Claudius
programme.desc: Sejanus asks Tiberius for permission to marry Livilla, but the Emperor turns him down, and Agrippina is banished to Pandateria, the same island where her mother was exiled by Augustus. Meanwhile, Caligula shrugs off Claudius' warning that he might be in grave danger. Derek Jacobi , Patrick Stewart and George Baker star

programme.title: I, Claudius
programme.desc: Caligula announces the death of Tiberius and is immediately hailed as the new Caesar. He begins to believe he has become a god when he is miraculously saved from a coma, but corruption soon sets in as he abuses his imperial power - with disastrous results. Derek Jacobi and John Hurt star

programme.title: I, Claudius
programme.desc: Claudius receives a letter and a set of loaded dice from Herod to improve his luck, while Caligula announces he is leaving to fight the Germans. On his return, the emperor is furious with the Senate because they did not mark his victory - despite him instructing them not to

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo explores the wild and rugged coastline of Northumberland by rail, beginning in Morpeth, where he finds an historic collection of Northumbrian bagpipes and discovers how difficult they are to play. The East Coast mainline delivers Michael to Widdrington and its long sandy bay, where a beachcombing blacksmith finds treasures to inspire artwork in steel

programme.title: Victorian Sensations
programme.desc: In the final episode, psychotherapist Philippa Perry explores ghosts, science and early cinema in the 1890s, and how the late Victorian passion for science co-exists with a deeply held belief in the paranormal

programme.title: Meet the Romans with Mary Beard
programme.desc: The professor delves deeper into ordinary Roman life by going behind the closed doors of the family home. She tells the stories of eccentric wife Glyconis - praised by her husband for liking a drink or two - Allia Potestas, who lived in a menage a trois, and 11-year-old schoolboy Sulpicius Maximus, worked to death by his pushy parents. Mary also paints a more detailed picture of slavery, revealing that many Romans chose to be buried with their servants

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels the length of the Northumbrian coastline, with its glorious beaches and grandiose castles. In the village of Alnmouth he takes to the waves in a traditional skiff built by members of the Alnmouth Coastal Rowing Club. His last stop of the day is the mighty Bamburgh Castle

programme.title: Climbing Great Buildings
programme.desc: Jonathan Foyle climbs the spires of New College, Oxford, a building constructed in 1379 that set the blueprint for universities all over the world. He investigates how the Black Death led to an architectural innovation and reveals how the quadrangle originated here. He also discovers carvings of English folk tales in the chapel and learns how a glazing technique helped create the medieval stained glass

programme.title: How We Tamed the Cat and Dog
programme.desc: Documentary examining archaeology and genetics to answer questions about cats, including where they came from and how they ended up living with humans. The programme examines how to read felines' enigmatic facial expressions, and studies the unusual behaviour of domestic pets that have turned feral

programme.title: In the Heat of the Night (1967)
programme.desc: When a wealthy industrialist is murdered in Mississippi, the bigoted local sheriff is quick to accuse a black newcomer to town - only to learn his suspect is a highly respected homicide detective from Philadelphia. However, the duo are forced to put aside their mutual loathing and team up to track down the killer. Oscar-winning drama, starring Sidney Poitier, Rod Steiger and Warren Oates

programme.title: Scene By Scene
programme.desc: Mark Cousins interviews Rod Steiger, star of numerous classics including On the Waterfront, Dr Zhivago, Oklahoma, The Pawnbroker and In the Heat of the Night. Never a conventional leading man, Steiger nevertheless changed the direction of movies and opened the way for the distinctive performances of Robert de Niro, who referred to him as the most important actor of his generation

programme.title: For a Few Dollars More (1965)
programme.desc: An enigmatic gunslinger forms an uneasy alliance with a military veteran to track down a notorious outlaw - but tensions simmer as their very different motives for the hunt put them increasingly at odds. Sergio Leone's Western sequel, starring Clint Eastwood, Lee Van Cleef, Gian Maria Volonte, Josef Egger, Mara Krup and Klaus Kinski

Grown-ups at home are encouraged to take part by hiding safe, baby-appropriate toys and objects inside a fabric bag or pillowcase for them to reveal and explore with their baby! programme.desc: Febo's family are from America, where they celebrate Thanksgiving. As it is traditional on Thanksgiving to prepare and serve pumpkin pie as a dessert, Febo is making this for his friends. He starts by making a pastry case and fitting it into a pie dish. For the pumpkin filling: he pours melted butter and buttermilk into a bowl of brown sugar, along with whisked egg, cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg, allspice and cloves. Febo adds his special ingredient, pumpkin puree, and then mixes them all together. When it's mixed, he spoons it into the empty pastry case and puts it in the oven to cook. Febo's friends all help to decorate his American-themed table before they taste his pumpkin pie.

programme.desc: Its the Big Beanbag Bash Day and Love Monster is very excited to throw some beanbags and win some games. Tiniest Fluffiest Bunny does better than he does, and Love Monster feels jealous of the attention that she gets. He becomes so frustrated that he kicks a beanbag and it hurtles towards the scoreboard, knocking all the points to the ground, ripping the bunting and giving Delivery Duckling, Elder Chick, Elder Panda and the In-Chicks a fright. The crowd is stunned into silence. Love Monster is horrified at what he has done and immediately says sorry. He explains that he wants everyone to cheer for him like they cheer for Tiniest Fluffiest Bunny. She admits it did feel good and tingly inside when everyone was cheering for her, but she says that everyone has something they are good at and Love Monster is the best beatboxer in Fluffytown. Love Monster realises that she is right and starts beatboxing. The Fluffytowners start having fun again and begin cheering for him.

programme.desc: Sebastiaan's making a South African bobotie, which is a local dish his family have shared with him. He starts by putting chopped spring onions, grated courgette, turmeric powder, ground coriander and torn red pepper into a casserole dish and cooking them. He then adds garlic puree, ginger puree, chutney and chopped tomatoes to cooked beef mince. Sebastiaan then carefully makes powder out of his special ingredient, cumin seeds, and adds the powder to the beef mixture. Sebastiaan mixes both the vegetables and the beef in an oven dish and flattens them before adding two bay leaves. He adds a topping of milk and egg and then places it in the oven. Sebastiaan has a wonderfully decorated table, and he has another traditional treat to go with his bobotie. Will his friends figure out what his special ingredient is?

The chef also meets a sea shanty group with a difference

programme.title: Escape to the Country

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Alex and his son Flynn bring in their cherished stuffed toy lamb for the attention of soft toy specialists Amanda Middleditch and Julie Tatchell. The toy was given to Alex when he was just four months old and after a lifetime of cuddling it has lost an eye, an ear and is less squishy than they would like. Next in is Alejandro with his Great Grandmother's breadcrumb maker that is over 100-years-old and has been passed through generations of his family. Years of use has left the machine unusable but with any luck, metal expert Dominic Chinea will be able to bring it back to life. Mark Stuckey gets to grips with a vintage radiogram that's been silent for years. Owner Sue remembers her late father tapping his toes to the sounds of Frank Sinatra and Glenn Miller and wants to be able to share that joy with her grandson Zayn

programme.title: The Finish Line
programme.desc: Roman Kemp and Sarah Greene host this quiz contest, in which five contestants race in moving podiums across the studio floor to try and win 5,000. The winner then races against the track itself in an attempt to win the cash prize

programme.title: The Following Events Are Based on a Pack of Lies

programme.title: Mavericks: Sport's Lost Heroes
programme.desc: A profile of former heavyweight boxer David Pearce, who enjoyed success in the ring during the 1980s, but had his biggest battle outside the ring

programme.title: Boot Dreams: Now or Never
programme.desc: The squad are at Macclesfield FC, minutes into their first game in front of scouts who could offer them new pro contracts, but disaster has already struck. Keeper Myles has been sent off for deliberately handling the ball outside his box. Substitute Goalie Abidan has had a difficult week already, and now finds himself facing a critical free kick, which he fails to keep out

programme.title: This Is Spinal Tap (1984)
programme.desc: An ageing British rock band try to revive their fortunes by embarking on a US tour, with a film-maker on hand to record the mayhem. However, the big comeback soon turns into a series of disasters as tensions between the clueless rockers and their long-suffering manager reach breaking point. Spoof documentary, starring Michael McKean, Christopher Guest, Harry Shearer and Rob Reiner

programme.title: Critical Incident
programme.desc: A police officer is run over while he searches for a van of drug runners and a call handler in Hampshire saves the life of a baby who isn't breathing. Plus, after a life changing injury, a former PC is finding his feet again

programme.title: Expert Witness
programme.desc: How the work of a blood residue specialist led police to the killers of an East Sussex waiter brutally bludgeoned in his flat. Plus, the forensic entomologist who uncovered a case of extreme neglect when a Merseyside grandmother was found dead at home. Presented by Ashley John-Baptiste

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell present the stories of a new development of houses in Stoke-on-Trent, a one-bedroom flat in Battersea and a Merseyside terrace bought to support new families living in the community

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Nick Hall and Ochuko Ojiri lead two teams competing at Ardingly Antiques Fair in West Sussex, as they hunt for potentially profitable items to take to auction. Presenter Christina Trevanion monitors their progress and also looks at the art and history of Persian carpets

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph visits Beaconsfield recycling centre where she finds a pile of discarded drawers for the attention of woodworker Kris Mutter, a potentially lucrative antique chair for furniture restorer Katie Keat and a drop-leaf table she plans to revamp

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick visits Europe's largest tea plantation, on the banks of the River Fal, bakes a simple yet sumptuous fruited tea loaf and travels to Penzande, where he enjoys an invigorating dip in the UK's largest outdoor seawater lido. He also finds out how Cornwall inspired Charles Dickens and how the county found its way into A Christmas Carol

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Margherita Taylor helps a retired army couple to find a secluded new home in Norfolk, and also learns about the trade in the world's most expensive spice, saffron

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jessie and her grandparents bring in a vintage ukulele with hopes that luthier Julyan Wallis can breathe new life into the instrument that has brought entertainment to four generations of their family. Julie Tatchell and Amanda Middleditch face a soft toy emergency when Nicola brings in a mechanical stuffed toy with memories of a much-missed father that needs a makeover after being attacked with lipstick. Carlo and Alessia bring in a 1960s split flap clock that's stuck in time for the attention of horologist Steve Fletcher

programme.title: The Finish Line
programme.desc: Roman Kemp and Sarah Greene host this quiz contest, in which five contestants race in moving podiums across the studio floor to try and win 5,000. The contenders battle across a series of fast-paced qualifiers and head-to-head races where the aim of the game is simple - to make it to the finish line before their rivals. The winner then races against the track itself in an attempt to win the cash prize

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Gyles Brandreth

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Roman Kemp and Jermaine Jenas present the magazine show, with stories of interest from around the UK, plus celebrity guests in the studio

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Gina and Anna confront their mum before heading to Peggy's to drown their sorrows. Phil makes it clear he wants Ian gone and Kathy finds out about Cindy's connection to the Knights. Bobby fears his new-found siblings will hate him for Lucy's death

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and the experts get to work on more heirlooms to bring them, and the memories they hold, back to life. Dominic Chinea faces the heavy-duty task of repairing a seized-up retro roundabout that reminds its owner Stella of her three daughters' childhoods. Wood expert Will Kirk is amazed when a First World War dominoes set, thought to have been played in the Christmas truce of 1914, arrives in the barn. Suzie Fletcher uses her leather skills on a 19th-century women's side saddle bought in Texas, and Julie and Amanda need the help of mechanical maestro Steve Fletcher to fix a broken teddy bear

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Strictly Come Dancing stars Anton Du Beke, Katya Jones and Graziano Di Prima join Nick Knowles and the team in Wallsend, Newcastle. Together, they set to work transforming the True Colours performing arts school, an inclusive dance school that teaches dance and theatre skills to 500 children and young adults weekly, many of whom have disabilities and learning needs. The school has grown substantially over time and they've completely outgrown their existing space, so the team get to work renovating a run-down old boys club that would give the dance school the extra space it so desperately needs to continue to transform more young lives

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Legends of Welsh Sport
programme.desc: A profile of the surfer, who overcame a devastating injury in a car crash to keep his dreams alive and earned respect in his profession around the world

programme.title: Ambulance
programme.desc: The first of two strike days affecting ambulance services across the country begins - the most widescale industrial action for a generation. North West Ambulance Service loses over a third of its workforce as staff join the picket lines to object over pay, working conditions and their concerns for patient safety. With limited resources, the service will only be responding to category one and two calls - the most life-threatening - and lesser category calls will not be sent an ambulance. Narrated by Christopher Eccleston

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Lee Mack researches his family tree, delving into the life of his great-grandfather and fellow comedian Billy. Not long into his journey, the Not Going Out star discovers that his relative was passionate about more than making people laugh as Billy joined the first-ever Pals Battalion in Liverpool at the start of the First World War and honed his act at the front lines in the Battle of the Somme. Lee also looks into the upbringing of his maternal grandfather Joe, who was deserted by his unwed mother

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Critical Incident
programme.desc: In London, emergency responders remember the nightmare they faced during the Westminster Bridge terror attack. In Staffordshire, a newly taser trained PC must decide whether to fire her taser for the first time - at a woman wielding two machetes

programme.title: Expert Witness
programme.desc: How a UK fibre specialist brought closure to Australia's longest-running murder investigation. Plus, the forensic pharmacologist who used her expertise to ensure a murder charge after two brutal killings. Presented by Ashley John-Baptiste

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martel Maxwell is in Shirley in the West Midlands to see a two-bed mid-terrace, bought to be a first-time home. She's also in Darlington, Co Durham, to meet an experienced developer with plans to bring a tired two bed terrace back to life. Tommy Walsh heads to Romford, Essex, to see a three-bed semi in need of some serious renovation

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Stephanie Connell and Raj Bisram help two teams look for items at Bath Racecourse, while presenter Eric Knowles look at Chinese ceramics with an eye-watering price tag

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore searches for unrealised gems among the junk at Wallyford Recycling Centre in East Lothian. She enlists the help of upholsterer Leigh-Anne Treadwell to work on an unloved armchair, while bag-maker Neil Wragg sets to work on a golf trolley and wooden box. Sarah herself has a Victorian trunk to revitalise. Narrated by Arthur Smith

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: The chef glimpses life in Cornwall 2,000 years ago as he explores the atmospheric ruins of the ancient village of Carn Euny. Rick also cooks his favourite Sunday lunch, a hearty steak and kidney pudding, and goes for a bracing ride on a beautiful hand-built boat

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton travels to the Warwickshire countryside to help a couple with a 600,000 budget finds a rural home for them and their two young daughters. While in the region, Alistair visits one of the country's last surviving water mills still running commercially and meets a miller harnessing the natural power of the River Avon to produce his flour

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Will Kirk is entrusted with the restoration of a cherished family crib, Dominic Chinea hopes to rejuvenate a rusted pogo stick that's lost its spring, while Chris Shaw attempts to reassemble the pages of a dilapidated cookbook. Presented by Jay Blades

programme.title: The Finish Line
programme.desc: Roman Kemp and Sarah Greene host this quiz contest, in which five contestants race in moving podiums across the studio floor to try and win 5,000. The contenders battle across a series of fast-paced qualifiers and head-to-head races where the aim of the game is simple - to make it to the finish line before their rivals. The winner then races against the track itself in an attempt to win the cash prize

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which five pairs of contestants have to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Stephen Mangan

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Live chat and topical reports, presented by Alex Jones and Roman Kemp

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Bobby tries to make amends with Anna but she asks that they stay friends. George breaks down as he orders Cindy and the rest of the Beales to leave the Square but they instead take refuge at Alfie's

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: The semi-finals continue, with the candidates joined by rapper, grime MC, songwriter and DJ Big Zuu. They are tasked to recreate one of his favourite recipes - getting to appreciate that food that is very personal to him. The celebrities need to deliver on the techniques, flavours and love that go into these dishes in order to impress Big Zuu and judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace. The celebrity who outshines the rest will earn a pass straight through to the next round. The remaining six must cook off and make a plate of food that evokes a special time and place in their lives

programme.title: Ambulance
programme.desc: It's a busy start to the shift, as North West Ambulance Service senior paramedic Aiden is dispatched to a category two patient who has fallen 20ft from a tree with an open wrist fracture. As Aiden treats the person, another job comes in for a two-year-old who has fallen from a balcony. Crewmates Jodie and Tom attend to a male patient who has been vomiting blood and is in need of urgent medical attention at Salford Royal. Narrated by Christopher Eccleston

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Dark Land: Hunting the Killers
programme.desc: The team re-examines the case of Suzanne Greenhill, a 20-year-old deaf woman from Newport. In 1988 Suzanne was found murdered at home, her body ghoulishly staged to represent the cover of an Iron Maiden heavy metal album cover. Detectives had to work closely with the deaf community to uncover the identity of Suzanne's killer, with pioneering forensic techniques called upon to secure a conviction. It has gone down in history as one of the most unique murder investigations in policing history

programme.title: Green Book (2018)
programme.desc: In the 1960s, working-class Italian-American bouncer Tony Lip becomes the driver of Dr Donald Shirley, an African-American classical pianist on a tour of venues through the American South. Director Peter Farrelly's Bafta and Oscar-winning comedy drama, starring Viggo Mortensen, Mahershala Ali and Linda Cardellini

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Lee Mack researches his family tree, delving into the life of his great-grandfather and fellow comedian Billy. Not long into his journey, the Not Going Out star discovers that his relative was passionate about more than making people laugh as Billy joined the first-ever Pals Battalion in Liverpool at the start of the First World War and honed his act at the front lines in the Battle of the Somme. Lee also looks into the upbringing of his maternal grandfather Joe, who was deserted by his unwed mother

programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Critical Incident
programme.desc: In London, emergency responders remember the nightmare they faced during the Westminster Bridge terror attack. In Staffordshire, a newly taser trained PC must decide whether to fire her taser for the first time - at a woman wielding two machetes

programme.title: Expert Witness
programme.desc: How a UK fibre specialist brought closure to Australia's longest-running murder investigation. Plus, the forensic pharmacologist who used her expertise to ensure a murder charge after two brutal killings. Presented by Ashley John-Baptiste

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martel Maxwell is in Shirley in the West Midlands to see a two-bed mid-terrace, bought to be a first-time home. She's also in Darlington, Co Durham, to meet an experienced developer with plans to bring a tired two bed terrace back to life. Tommy Walsh heads to Romford, Essex, to see a three-bed semi in need of some serious renovation

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Stephanie Connell and Raj Bisram help two teams look for items at Bath Racecourse, while presenter Eric Knowles look at Chinese ceramics with an eye-watering price tag

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore searches for unrealised gems among the junk at Wallyford Recycling Centre in East Lothian. She enlists the help of upholsterer Leigh-Anne Treadwell to work on an unloved armchair, while bag-maker Neil Wragg sets to work on a golf trolley and wooden box. Sarah herself has a Victorian trunk to revitalise. Narrated by Arthur Smith

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: The chef glimpses life in Cornwall 2,000 years ago as he explores the atmospheric ruins of the ancient village of Carn Euny. Rick also cooks his favourite Sunday lunch, a hearty steak and kidney pudding, and goes for a bracing ride on a beautiful hand-built boat

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton travels to the Warwickshire countryside to help a couple with a 600,000 budget finds a rural home for them and their two young daughters. While in the region, Alistair visits one of the country's last surviving water mills still running commercially and meets a miller harnessing the natural power of the River Avon to produce his flour

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Will Kirk is entrusted with the restoration of a cherished family crib, Dominic Chinea hopes to rejuvenate a rusted pogo stick that's lost its spring, while Chris Shaw attempts to reassemble the pages of a dilapidated cookbook. Presented by Jay Blades

programme.title: The Finish Line
programme.desc: Roman Kemp and Sarah Greene host this quiz contest, in which five contestants race in moving podiums across the studio floor to try and win 5,000. The contenders battle across a series of fast-paced qualifiers and head-to-head races where the aim of the game is simple - to make it to the finish line before their rivals. The winner then races against the track itself in an attempt to win the cash prize

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which five pairs of contestants have to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Stephen Mangan

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Live chat and topical reports, presented by Alex Jones and Roman Kemp

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Bobby tries to make amends with Anna but she asks that they stay friends. George breaks down as he orders Cindy and the rest of the Beales to leave the Square but they instead take refuge at Alfie's

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: The semi-finals continue, with the candidates joined by rapper, grime MC, songwriter and DJ Big Zuu. They are tasked to recreate one of his favourite recipes - getting to appreciate that food that is very personal to him. The celebrities need to deliver on the techniques, flavours and love that go into these dishes in order to impress Big Zuu and judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace. The celebrity who outshines the rest will earn a pass straight through to the next round. The remaining six must cook off and make a plate of food that evokes a special time and place in their lives

programme.title: Ambulance
programme.desc: It's a busy start to the shift, as North West Ambulance Service senior paramedic Aiden is dispatched to a category two patient who has fallen 20ft from a tree with an open wrist fracture. As Aiden treats the person, another job comes in for a two-year-old who has fallen from a balcony. Crewmates Jodie and Tom attend to a male patient who has been vomiting blood and is in need of urgent medical attention at Salford Royal. Narrated by Christopher Eccleston

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Green Book (2018)
programme.desc: In the 1960s, working-class Italian-American bouncer Tony Lip becomes the driver of Dr Donald Shirley, an African-American classical pianist on a tour of venues through the American South. Director Peter Farrelly's Bafta and Oscar-winning comedy drama, starring Viggo Mortensen, Mahershala Ali and Linda Cardellini
