programme.title: Critical Incident
programme.desc: Emergency services personnel that were on the scene look back on the 7/7 attacks in London and a volatile patient assaults two paramedics on the Isle of Wight. A police dog unit face a man with a crowbar

programme.title: Expert Witness
programme.desc: An expert witness helps link a drug gang to the death of a Vietnamese man in Wales, and experts in DNA and fibre analysis provide the evidence needed to convict a killer in Bristol

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martel Maxwell hears about the plans for renovation on a ground floor one-bed flat in South Shields, South Tyneside that has potential to be a holiday let. A three-bed semi in Birmingham has an issue with its non-standard construction. Jacqui Joseph meets with a seasoned developer with grand plans plans for a four-bedroom house in Dover

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross hosts from the Agricultural Showground on Anglesey, where antique experts Roo Irvine and Richard Madley guide two teams as they search for items of interest and value to take to auction. Away from the contest, Charlie also meets a familiar face with a passion for Georgian glass

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore visits Keynsham recycling centre where she finds an assortment of bed linens for designer Zoe Murphy, a pair of chairs for upholsterer Simion Hawtin-Smith and a large collection of dog ornaments for her to upcycle and sell on

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick makes heritage cider with Raynor Winn, author of The Salt Path, and cooks chicken, leek and cider gratin for his friend John Harris, the head gardener at Tresillian House, who regales Rick with his memories of cider-making as a boy. The chef also meets a sea shanty group with a difference

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman helps a couple find a property in Pembrokeshire with holiday let potential. Plus, some entrepreneurs who turned a derelict farmhouse into a B&B

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Alex and his son Flynn bring in their cherished stuffed toy lamb for the attention of soft toy specialists Amanda Middleditch and Julie Tatchell. The toy was given to Alex when he was just four months old and after a lifetime of cuddling it has lost an eye, an ear and is less squishy than they would like. Next in is Alejandro with his Great Grandmother's breadcrumb maker that is over 100-years-old and has been passed through generations of his family. Years of use has left the machine unusable but with any luck, metal expert Dominic Chinea will be able to bring it back to life. Mark Stuckey gets to grips with a vintage radiogram that's been silent for years. Owner Sue remembers her late father tapping his toes to the sounds of Frank Sinatra and Glenn Miller and wants to be able to share that joy with her grandson Zayn

programme.title: The Finish Line
programme.desc: Roman Kemp and Sarah Greene host this quiz contest, in which five contestants race in moving podiums across the studio floor to try and win 5,000. The contenders battle across a series of fast-paced qualifiers and head-to-head races where the aim of the game is simple - to make it to the finish line before their rivals. The winner then races against the track itself in an attempt to win the cash prize

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Gyles Brandreth

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Scott and Roman Kemp present another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Despite his initial shock, George is angry to learn Cindy didn't return to the square for their family. Peter learns the real reason Ian didn't want his mum to return to Walford and Sharon and Phil get a shock when they run into Ian

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: The first of the semi-finals is hosted in County Durham at the Beamish Museum. The contestants are thrown in at the deep end, cooking in tents and using unfamiliar equipment to serve up a four course meal for 100 of the museum's staff and volunteers

programme.title: The Following Events Are Based on a Pack of Lies
programme.desc: Drama starring Rebekah Staton. Alice begins investigating her conman ex-husband as he starts dating a famous author. After 15 years, she's determined to get the truth but it turns out the pair must work together if they're ever going to stop him

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Boot Dreams: Now or Never
programme.desc: The squad are at Macclesfield FC, minutes into their first game in front of scouts who could offer them new pro contracts, but disaster has already struck. Keeper Myles has been sent off for deliberately handling the ball outside his box. Substitute Goalie Abidan has had a difficult week already, and now finds himself facing a critical free kick, which he fails to keep out

programme.title: This Is Spinal Tap (1984)
programme.desc: An ageing British rock band try to revive their fortunes by embarking on a US tour, with a film-maker on hand to record the mayhem. However, the big comeback soon turns into a series of disasters as tensions between the clueless rockers and their long-suffering manager reach breaking point. Spoof documentary, starring Michael McKean, Christopher Guest, Harry Shearer and Rob Reiner

programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Critical Incident
programme.desc: A police officer is run over while he searches for a van of drug runners and a call handler in Hampshire saves the life of a baby who isn't breathing. Plus, after a life changing injury, a former PC is finding his feet again

programme.title: Expert Witness
programme.desc: How the work of a blood residue specialist led police to the killers of an East Sussex waiter brutally bludgeoned in his flat. Plus, the forensic entomologist who uncovered a case of extreme neglect when a Merseyside grandmother was found dead at home. Presented by Ashley John-Baptiste

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell present the stories of a new development of houses in Stoke-on-Trent, a one-bedroom flat in Battersea and a Merseyside terrace bought to support new families living in the community

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Nick Hall and Ochuko Ojiri lead two teams competing at Ardingly Antiques Fair in West Sussex, as they hunt for potentially profitable items to take to auction. Presenter Christina Trevanion monitors their progress and also looks at the art and history of Persian carpets

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph visits Beaconsfield recycling centre where she finds a pile of discarded drawers for the attention of woodworker Kris Mutter, a potentially lucrative antique chair for furniture restorer Katie Keat and a drop-leaf table she plans to revamp

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick visits Europe's largest tea plantation, on the banks of the River Fal, bakes a simple yet sumptuous fruited tea loaf and travels to Penzande, where he enjoys an invigorating dip in the UK's largest outdoor seawater lido. He also finds out how Cornwall inspired Charles Dickens and how the county found its way into A Christmas Carol

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Margherita Taylor helps a retired army couple to find a secluded new home in Norfolk, and also learns about the trade in the world's most expensive spice, saffron

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jessie and her grandparents bring in a vintage ukulele with hopes that luthier Julyan Wallis can breathe new life into the instrument that has brought entertainment to four generations of their family. Julie Tatchell and Amanda Middleditch face a soft toy emergency when Nicola brings in a mechanical stuffed toy with memories of a much-missed father that needs a makeover after being attacked with lipstick. Carlo and Alessia bring in a 1960s split flap clock that's stuck in time for the attention of horologist Steve Fletcher

programme.title: The Finish Line
programme.desc: Roman Kemp and Sarah Greene host this quiz contest, in which five contestants race in moving podiums across the studio floor to try and win 5,000. The contenders battle across a series of fast-paced qualifiers and head-to-head races where the aim of the game is simple - to make it to the finish line before their rivals. The winner then races against the track itself in an attempt to win the cash prize

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Gyles Brandreth

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Roman Kemp and Jermaine Jenas present the magazine show, with stories of interest from around the UK, plus celebrity guests in the studio

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Gina and Anna confront their mum before heading to Peggy's to drown their sorrows. Phil makes it clear he wants Ian gone and Kathy finds out about Cindy's connection to the Knights. Bobby fears his new-found siblings will hate him for Lucy's death

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and the experts get to work on more heirlooms to bring them, and the memories they hold, back to life. Dominic Chinea faces the heavy-duty task of repairing a seized-up retro roundabout that reminds its owner Stella of her three daughters' childhoods. Wood expert Will Kirk is amazed when a First World War dominoes set, thought to have been played in the Christmas truce of 1914, arrives in the barn. Suzie Fletcher uses her leather skills on a 19th-century women's side saddle bought in Texas, and Julie and Amanda need the help of mechanical maestro Steve Fletcher to fix a broken teddy bear

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Strictly Come Dancing stars Anton Du Beke, Katya Jones and Graziano Di Prima join Nick Knowles and the team in Wallsend, Newcastle. Together, they set to work transforming the True Colours performing arts school, an inclusive dance school that teaches dance and theatre skills to 500 children and young adults weekly, many of whom have disabilities and learning needs. The school has grown substantially over time and they've completely outgrown their existing space, so the team get to work renovating a run-down old boys club that would give the dance school the extra space it so desperately needs to continue to transform more young lives

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Ambulance
programme.desc: The first of two strike days affecting ambulance services across the country begins - the most widescale industrial action for a generation. North West Ambulance Service loses over a third of its workforce as staff join the picket lines to object over pay, working conditions and their concerns for patient safety. With limited resources, the service will only be responding to category one and two calls - the most life-threatening - and lesser category calls will not be sent an ambulance. Narrated by Christopher Eccleston

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Lee Mack researches his family tree, delving into the life of his great-grandfather and fellow comedian Billy. Not long into his journey, the Not Going Out star discovers that his relative was passionate about more than making people laugh as Billy joined the first-ever Pals Battalion in Liverpool at the start of the First World War and honed his act at the front lines in the Battle of the Somme. Lee also looks into the upbringing of his maternal grandfather Joe, who was deserted by his unwed mother

programme.title: Patrick Kielty's Tractor Wars: Ferguson vs Ford
programme.desc: The presenter explores the untold story of Harry Ferguson and Henry Ford's remarkable handshake agreement, and how it led to a $250million lawsuit. In 1938, Ferguson and Ford - two former farm boys - shook hands on a 'gentleman's agreement' with the ambition to change the agricultural world for ever. Henry Ford, founder of the Ford Motor Company, and Harry Ferguson, the Ulster inventor, agreed to mass-produce an ingenious new tractor. Together they hoped to mechanise the world of the struggling small farmer on an industrial scale, and put an end to the depressed 1930s

programme.title: Windrush: Portraits of a Generation
programme.desc: Marking the 75th anniversary of the arrival of the HMT Empire Windrush to British shores in 1948, cameras follow a project spearheaded by King Charles. He commissioned 10 leading artists, from Britain and abroad, to create portraits of 10 pioneering members of the Windrush Generation. The sitters, many in their nineties, speak frankly about their experiences of arriving in Britain, making lives for themselves, and the contribution they have made to their communities and the nation

programme.desc: Children's stories about the First World War, featuring the tale of a 13-year-old Flemish girl who was severely punished by a German officer for stealing some potatoes. Fleeing her home, she crossed an electric fence on the Belgian border to raise money to save her family from the crippling fines they had to pay on her behalf

programme.title: Dn
programme.desc: Eilidh Cormack discusses and reads the poem Thig Tr Nithean Gun Iarraidh by the Daughter of the Laird of Rilig. She speaks about how its messages are still relevant today

programme.title: Sgeulachd Deacon Brodie
programme.desc: John Morrison explores the life of Edinburgh-born William Brodie, whose criminal dealings and double identity is believed to have inspired Robert Louis Stevenson's character Dr Jekyll and Mr Hyde. The presenter investigates why the ambiguous man who was hanged for his affairs in 1889 is still regarded with affection in the Scottish capital, with the help of expert opinion and drama reconstruction

programme.desc: Heather Dewar visits Glasgow, where she draws a colour portrait of singer Joy Dunlop

programme.title: Pris Tartan (Tartan Pride)
programme.desc: The history of the first international football match, which took place in 1872, and saw Scotland face England, setting an emotional, cultural and historical precedent that endures through to the modern day

programme.title: Mach Seo!
programme.desc: In search of wildlife and adventure, Ramsay MacMahon heads to the Black Isle for a few days and travels up the coastline to Chanonry Point

programme.title: Abhnichean san Iarmailt/Rivers Above the Canopy
programme.desc: Often considered as the beating heart of the Earth, the trees in the Amazon absorb water from the ground and pump out billion of tons of water vapour a day into vast 'flying rivers', essential to the environmental balance. But what if this natural phenomenon was to disappear? What would be the ecological consequences on our planet? From the Amazon rainforest to some of the world's top laboratories and research centres, and thanks to 3D animation sequences, this scientific investigation deciphers the mechanisms of this extraordinary phenomenon

programme.title: Dhan Uisge
programme.desc: Calum Maclean swims at the Falls of Lora, where River Etive meets The Firth of Lorne. He often looks for a challenge and tries to find locations that other swimmers do not frequent

programme.title: ITV Lunchtime News
programme.desc: The key headlines from the day so far

programme.title: ITV News London
programme.desc: Headlines affecting the local area

programme.title: James Martin's Great British Adventure
programme.desc: James goes on a culinary road trip around the UK and kicks off his travels in the Orkneys, where he is joined by fellow chef Nick Nairn. He shops for hand-dived scallops, before setting up his mobile kitchen in Stromness harbour to make barbecue scallops with black pudding, apple and hazelnut butter. He also meets the owner of a unique herd of sheep in the remote island of North Ronaldsay

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: CJ and his dad Caspar from Dorchester, siblings Marie and Claire from Craigavon, and Will and Helen from London and Bristol use their powers of deduction to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. The last remaining duo have the opportunity to win the money they've banked earlier in the show to potentially double their winnings, or leaving with nothing. Adil Ray hosts

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Richard, Ali, Dany and Lesley pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: ITV News London
programme.desc: Headlines affecting the local area

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Claudette is horrified by Victor's betrayal. Nate is starting to get in too deep. Charity accepts Gail's dare

programme.title: Paul O'Grady's Great British Escape
programme.desc: In a new six-part series, Paul O'Grady shares the beautiful sights, stories and secrets of his beloved adopted home county, Kent. In a year where many people have chosen to holiday closer to home due to the Covid-19 pandemic, Paul embraces the opportunity to rediscover what the county has to offer. In Dover Harbour, Paul boards a speed boat to blast along the iconic white cliffs, where he has an encounter with a colony of harbour seals living on a disused MOD Navy base. Later, he arrives in Whitstable to meet the West family, who have been sorting, selling and shucking oysters for five generations

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and the team create an elegant tea garden for a charity volunteer in Birmingham who makes cakes for injured members of the services. The garden includes a fully equipped kitchen so she can bake pies and cakes in the fresh air, raised beds for growing fresh ingredients, and a colourful living wall. Plus, Katie Rushworth offers tips on balcony and rooftop gardening

programme.title: The Tower
programme.desc: Sarah and Lizzie must work together to track down a murderer and a missing child. A new suspect emerges in Sarah's investigation into Tania Mills' disappearance. Crime drama, starring Gemma Whelan and Tahirah Sharif

programme.title: Identity Thief (2013)
programme.desc: A con-woman acquires an executive's credit card numbers, and lives a life of luxury at his expense. The outraged victim sets out on a mission to track down the fraudster and bring her to justice personally - resulting in them travelling on a disastrous road trip across America together. Comedy, with Jason Bateman, Melissa McCarthy, Jon Favreau and Amanda Peet

programme.title: James Martin's Great British Adventure
programme.desc: James goes on a culinary road trip around the UK and kicks off his travels in the Orkneys, where he is joined by fellow chef Nick Nairn. He also meets the owner of a unique herd of sheep in the remote island of North Ronaldsay

programme.title: Lingo

programme.title: Paul O'Grady's Great British Escape
programme.desc: In a new six-part series, Paul O'Grady shares the beautiful sights, stories and secrets of his beloved adopted home county, Kent. In a year where many people have chosen to holiday closer to home due to the Covid-19 pandemic, Paul embraces the opportunity to rediscover what the county has to offer. In Dover Harbour, Paul boards a speed boat to blast along the iconic white cliffs, where he has an encounter with a colony of harbour seals living on a disused MOD Navy base. Later, he arrives in Whitstable to meet the West family, who have been sorting, selling and shucking oysters for five generations

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and the team create an elegant tea garden for a charity volunteer in Birmingham who makes cakes for injured members of the services. The garden includes a fully equipped kitchen so she can bake pies and cakes in the fresh air, raised beds for growing fresh ingredients, and a colourful living wall. Plus, Katie Rushworth offers tips on balcony and rooftop gardening

programme.title: The Tower
programme.desc: Sarah and Lizzie must work together to track down a murderer and a missing child. A new suspect emerges in Sarah's investigation into Tania Mills' disappearance. Crime drama, starring Gemma Whelan and Tahirah Sharif

programme.desc: Kirsty met Jack in primary school and it has taken her 15 years to build up the courage to confess her feelings for him, while Rory takes a risk with his colleague

programme.title: Dinner Date
programme.desc: Nick from Leeds picks three blind dates from five potential partners, based entirely on the menus they have created

programme.title: Family Fortunes
programme.desc: Gino D'Acampo hosts the game show in which two teams of family members try to guess the most popular responses to surveys posed to 100 people. programme.title: Chuck
programme.desc: The spy meets an attractive woman by the name of Lou, and realises he must learn to balance his real love life with the one he uses as a cover. Trouble is never far away, however, and news breaks that someone is using a truth serum to obtain codes for various nuclear facilities

programme.title: One Tree Hill

Rural drama, starring Pam Ferris and Sarah Lancashire

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Blaketon spots local coal merchant Arthur Bolton sharing a kiss with another woman and quickly gives the man's wife the bad news. However, the cheat is found murdered the next day and the former policeman becomes the prime suspect, leaving PC Walker to lead an investigation to clear his name. Peggy fails to back a winner when she buys a greyhound that refuses to run, and Bellamy's love life gets a much-needed boost

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Rob lands himself in trouble when he spends the night with Helen, getting Geoff to cover his shift - and matters grow complicated after it's revealed that the doctor's estranged husband made the complaint. programme.desc: Curly reacts less than favourably to Emma's news, which results in her asking for a divorce. Steve takes time off work to track down Karen

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: After receiving a chilling phone call, the detective and sidekick DC Presley stumble on an exotic animal smuggling ring at a farm - where it appears an old adversary of Frost has been eaten by a crocodile. Meanwhile, a couple return from holiday to find the naked corpse of a man in their bedroom, prompting the husband to assume his wife was having an affair. Starring David Jason

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Former EastEnder and The Bill bad cop Todd Carty guest stars in this festive special of the rural drama. He plays an old army pal of Lord Ashfordly who moves into the hall while the peer is sunning himself in Bermuda, claiming he's there to keep an eye on the place after rumours of a planned break-in. However, he arouses the police's suspicions when he becomes involved with a teenage tearaway who seems to think Christmas isn't so much about giving and receiving as taking without the owner's permission. Elsewhere in the village, Blaketon and Peggy go into competition with rival Santa's grottos, and Ventress has his nose put out of joint when his friends draw straws to see who'll invite him to Christmas dinner while his wife's in hospital

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Convicted murderer Henry Stoddard's release from prison coincides with a spate of vandalism, and locals presume he is responsible for the petty crime. But when the former jailbird insists he did not kill PC Machin all those years ago, Walker reopens the case and races to stop Machin's son exacting revenge. Meanwhile, Peggy sees the chance to make some money when her birth certificate suggests she is related to Lord Ashfordly

programme.desc: An international cycling competition comes to the Midsomer village of Burwood Mantle, but when the race leader is murdered, DCI Barnaby and DS Nelson must investigate. During the race's finale, the victim overtook his team-mate to win, leaving the team owner annoyed that he disobeyed his orders, and the rival manager disappointed that his team lost. However, as the pair look into the case, they find themselves drawn into a competitive world of blackmail, bribery and bloodshed, where winning comes at any cost

programme.desc: A runaway heiress accompanies her crooked boyfriend on a series of armed robberies. But when the Sixties version of Bonnie and Clyde get into trouble they kidnap Helen, who attempts to persuade the teenager to ditch her partner in crime. Meanwhile, Peggy suggests David should take over the funeral parlour while Bernie is away. Rural drama with Sophie Ward, David Stockwell and Gwen Taylor

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: The detective suspects a connection between the death of a student with secret plans for advancement and the killing of well-known criminal Nicky Turnbull, who was in Oxford to speak at the Union. As Lewis and Hathaway eliminate suspects from a long list of the crook's enemies, the investigation brings him into contact with old flame Diane - who also happens to be Turnbull's wife. Kevin Whately stars, with Laurence Fox and Gina McKee

programme.title: Stonehouse
programme.desc: With Wilson's fate still on a knife edge and Barbara wondering if it's worth saving her marriage, John and Sheila go on trial to face the consequences of their actions. Fact-based drama about ambitious British politician John Stonehouse, starring Matthew Macfadyen

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The Belgian detective is summoned to a hotel by a mysterious veiled lady who tells him that her forthcoming marriage is under threat because she is being blackmailed over a love letter. Drama, starring David Suchet and Frances Barber

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Stephen is staggered by an unexpected revelation, while Sandra begins to get cold feet about the direction her life is taking. Elsewhere, elderly farmer Kate Price is distressed at the prospect of leaving Skelthwaite for Manchester. Drama, starring Jason Done, Melanie Kilburn and Pam Ferris

programme.desc: Stan and Jack persuade Inspector Blake to buy Arthur's old motorbike - but he runs into trouble on the test drive. Comedy, starring Reg Varney and Bob Grant

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: The nerves set in as Sandra wakes for the first day of her new job, which sees her helping a man understand his poorly father's deteriorating condition. programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Henry organises a team-building exercise in the Lake District for Goddard's staff - an adventure that nearly ends in tragedy. Jacqui continues to push Stephen away, going for a scan without even telling him, but an awkward encounter with Alison during a girls' night out changes her perspective. Drama, starring Pam Ferris and Sarah Lancashire

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Local boy Barry Dyson is accused of a series of arson attacks - and his clandestine relationship with a former employer's daughter complicates his plea of innocence. Peggy's latest money-making scheme with old friend Denzil creates an eyesore, forcing Jack to use his artistic flair to rectify matters, before he and Blaketon resort to more drastic - and illegal - measures. Rural drama, starring Gwen Taylor and Derek Fowlds

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A runaway heiress accompanies her crooked boyfriend on a series of armed robberies. But when the Sixties version of Bonnie and Clyde get into trouble they kidnap Helen, who attempts to persuade the teenager to ditch her partner in crime. programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Jack confronts Robert and exacts his own brand of rough justice. Elsewhere, Zoe tells Debbie to keep well away from baby Noah

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Jack presents Robert with a stark choice between Katie and his family, while Ashley tells Laurel he doesn't think Ethan's friendship with Debbie is appropriate

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Peter resolves to see Lucy, arriving just in time for the birth, while Emma is less than keen when Curly decides to inform Les that they're leaving for Newcastle

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Peter realises he wants to be a part of his son's life and visits Lucy to discuss his future as a father. Elsewhere, Steve tracks down Karen, and Rosie prepares for her audition

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The sleuth is asked to investigate the disappearance of a bank's most valued customer, who had been planning to sell the chairman a map showing where to find a long-lost silver mine. David Suchet stars

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: A dentist falls in love with his young assistant. His anxious wife, believing he has made plans to poison her and thereby remove the main obstacle to happiness, calls for Poirot's help. Drama, starring David Suchet

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: The police are called in to investigate when a local judge is the target of a series of mysterious attacks, but the case takes a sinister turn when the prime suspect is found dead on his own doorstep. Peggy is delighted when David's new radio starts picking up police broadcasts, but a news reporter doesn't share her enthusiasm. Rural drama, with Gwen Taylor and David Lonsdale

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: The rural drama returns after a winter break. A woman receives a shock when a man claiming to be her dead husband surfaces in the village and attempts to pick up the threads of his former life - though the locals aren't convinced of his identity. Lord Ashfordly's behaviour takes a strange turn after he eats some of Peggy's peculiar batch of mushrooms. Gwen Taylor and Rupert Vansittart star

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: A body is found buried on the Northumberland moors which could be a missing teenager from the nearby rural community of Brindale. The girl had disappeared six weeks previously, and Vera has to break the news to her devastated family. However, the realisation that she died so close to home rather than at a music festival as originally thought creates tension among her neighbours, who are soon suspecting each other of murder. The detective delves into the vulnerable young woman's isolated existence to identify her killer

programme.title: The Thief, His Wife and the Canoe
programme.desc: Plagued by debt and facing bankruptcy, John Darwin decides to fake his own death, much to the horror of his wife Anne. They successfully pull the scam off and John goes into hiding, while Anne consoles her sons. Fact-based drama, starring Eddie Marsan and Monica Dolan

programme.title: The Thief, His Wife and the Canoe
programme.desc: John successfully applies for a passport to create a new identity, while forcing Anne to demand an inquest into his death so they can get the insurance pay-out. Miraculously it works and the cheques arrive and the couple plan a new life together in Panama. Fact-based drama, starring Eddie Marsan and Monica Dolan

programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Jack takes Victoria to a doctor, who confirms her silence has been caused by a traumatic experience, while Debbie decides to ensure Charity doesn't profit from selling baby Noah

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Charity receives a hefty legal bill and finds herself forced to ask Tom King for a job, while Marlon becomes obsessed with the idea that a part of Tricia lives on in Carrie

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Martin feels uneasy about living under the same roof as Katy, Tyrone asks Maz out on a date and Steve turns to drink in an attempt to forget Karen

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Sarah has second thoughts about living with Todd, Martin decides to end his relationship with Katy, and Curly is still in the throes of his mid-life crisis

programme.title: On the Buses
programme.desc: A female trainee arrives at the depot and attracts the attention of the men - until they discover she is the inspector's niece

programme.title: On the Buses
programme.desc: Stan buys a home brew kit and begins making his own beer - but underestimates its strength and turns up for work in no fit state to drive a bus. Comedy, starring Reg Varney

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Vic finds himself at the centre of a furore concerning the uncertain future of a promising rugby player and the situation at the Snow's reaches crisis point as it becomes clear that although four may be company, seven is most definitely a crowd. Rural drama, starring Pam Ferris and Sarah Lancashire

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Ruth suffers the devastation of losing her baby as her pregnancy comes to an abrupt end, prompting husband Simon to turn to Peggy for support. Passionate feelings emerge between Alison and Stephen, and a medical crisis forces two elderly brothers to reach the conclusion that life's too short to be perpetually at each other's throats. Rural drama, starring Pam Ferris and Sarah Lancashire

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Blaketon spots local coal merchant Arthur Bolton sharing a kiss with another woman and quickly gives the man's wife the bad news. However, the cheat is found murdered the next day and the former policeman becomes the prime suspect, leaving PC Walker to lead an investigation to clear his name. Peggy fails to back a winner when she buys a greyhound that refuses to run, and Bellamy's love life gets a much-needed boost

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Rob lands himself in trouble when he spends the night with Helen, getting Geoff to cover his shift - and matters grow complicated after it's revealed that the doctor's estranged husband made the complaint. When a truck careers into a couple's back garden following a routine MOT test Bernie struggles to remember if he changed the bald tyres, and a snooping journalist soon forces the muddled mechanic to flee

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Charity begins her new job, and Jarvis manages to coax a smile out of Victoria with the help of a ventriloquist's dummy, while Marlon continues to harass Carrie

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Marlon finally says goodbye to Tricia, and star cricket player Ethan announces he has broken a finger, plunging the local team's morale to an all-time low

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Martin helps Katy get a summer job, and Curly is thrilled when Emma throws him a surprise birthday party in the Rovers - until she delivers earth-shattering news

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Curly reacts less than favourably to Emma's news, which results in her asking for a divorce. Steve takes time off work to track down Karen

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: After receiving a chilling phone call, the detective and sidekick DC Presley stumble on an exotic animal smuggling ring at a farm - where it appears an old adversary of Frost has been eaten by a crocodile. Meanwhile, a couple return from holiday to find the naked corpse of a man in their bedroom, prompting the husband to assume his wife was having an affair. Starring David Jason

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Former EastEnder and The Bill bad cop Todd Carty guest stars in this festive special of the rural drama. He plays an old army pal of Lord Ashfordly who moves into the hall while the peer is sunning himself in Bermuda, claiming he's there to keep an eye on the place after rumours of a planned break-in. However, he arouses the police's suspicions when he becomes involved with a teenage tearaway who seems to think Christmas isn't so much about giving and receiving as taking without the owner's permission. Elsewhere in the village, Blaketon and Peggy go into competition with rival Santa's grottos, and Ventress has his nose put out of joint when his friends draw straws to see who'll invite him to Christmas dinner while his wife's in hospital

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Convicted murderer Henry Stoddard's release from prison coincides with a spate of vandalism, and locals presume he is responsible for the petty crime. But when the former jailbird insists he did not kill PC Machin all those years ago, Walker reopens the case and races to stop Machin's son exacting revenge. Meanwhile, Peggy sees the chance to make some money when her birth certificate suggests she is related to Lord Ashfordly

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: An international cycling competition comes to the Midsomer village of Burwood Mantle, but when the race leader is murdered, DCI Barnaby and DS Nelson must investigate. During the race's finale, the victim overtook his team-mate to win, leaving the team owner annoyed that he disobeyed his orders, and the rival manager disappointed that his team lost. However, as the pair look into the case, they find themselves drawn into a competitive world of blackmail, bribery and bloodshed, where winning comes at any cost

programme.title: Stonehouse
programme.desc: John draws suspicion from local police while hiding out in Melbourne, while Barbara and Sheila fly to Australia to confront the disappeared MP. Fact-based drama about ambitious British politician John Stonehouse, starring Matthew Macfadyen and Keeley Hawes

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: A well-known eccentric contacts the Belgian sleuth when he is haunted by suicidal nightmares. However, he fails to follow Poirot's advice, and is found dead soon afterwards. Drama, starring David Suchet, with Joely Richardson and Mary Tamm

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Vic finds himself at the centre of a furore concerning the uncertain future of a promising rugby player and the situation at the Snow's reaches crisis point as it becomes clear that although four may be company, seven is most definitely a crowd. programme.title: Sport Filler Shows (2020)
programme.desc: A selection of nine dart finishes from ITV Sport's darts coverage through the years

programme.title: Minder
programme.desc: Arthur attempts to protect his friend Sidney, who on mistakenly being diagnosed with a fatal illness, arranged for a hitman to kill him so his wife would benefit from his life insurance. While Ray attempts to counter the deal, the best safe house the dodgy dealer can provide is a leaky caravan in Brighton, the property of Dave's sister. Andrew Sachs guest stars, with George Cole and Gary Webster

programme.title: The Professionals
programme.desc: CI5 uncovers a plan to hold the home secretary hostage in order to demand the release of a dangerous prisoner. Cowley takes the politician's place at an award ceremony, hoping that with Bodie as his bodyguard, he can draw the enemy into the open and thwart the attempt. Drama, starring Martin Shaw, Gordon Jackson and Lewis Collins, and featuring Pamela Stephenson in an early role

programme.title: Extreme Salvage Squad
programme.desc: The team drives to Kalgoorlie, the gold mining capital of Australia, to salvage a 10-tonne gold dry-blower that has been sitting idle for months and is costing its owner hundreds of thousands of dollars in lost revenue. With the price of gold skyrocketing, the owner wants to get it repaired and back out onto the goldfields. The team has one day and a budget of 20,000 dollars to retrieve the money-making machine.

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: On a volcanic island in the Pacific Ring of Fire, an ancient fishing community is being terrorised by something in the water that has left behind a trail of bloodied victims. With a collective knowledge built up over centuries, these fishermen thought they knew everything in these waters - until now. The only clue they have to the attacker's identity are the large puncture wounds it has left behind. Here, angling detective Jeremy Wade journeys to this land of fire and folklore to put himself to the ultimate test - can he uncover the identity of this mysterious fanged assailant?

Every year profits nosedive through the bleak winter months, and matters aren't improved when it becomes clear they have both lost their passion - not only for the business but also for each other. With the restaurant and marriage on the line, Gordon tries to help turn things around before it's too late

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Oxfordshire, amateur MC James and his partner Heather have every confidence in their French-influenced food, which they follow with a basement rave. However, there is a frosty atmosphere between guests barmaid Marjie and partner Matt, and refined farming couple Sonja and Tutty. The second day sees Marjie and Matt stage an evening themed on the Titanic, but their 'chilly' soup proves a bit too spicy for one guest. programme.title: London Bridge: Facing Terror
programme.desc: Reflections of the terrorist attack of November 2019, in which Jack Merritt and Saskia Jones were killed and two other people injured by Usman Khan as he wielded a kitchen knife. Darryn Frost, Steven Gallant and John Crilly each played a role in stopping the attacker from committing further appalling deeds. However, when the past criminality of Steven and John were bought to the fore, the narrative shifted. Darryn, Steven and John share their story of the attack in detail for the first time, as well as exploring how each was shaped by events in their past, which ultimately led them to all be at Fishmongers' Hall on that fateful day

programme.title: Bone Detectives: Britain's Buried Secrets
programme.desc: Tori Herridge and a team of scientists attempt to piece together the lives behind discovered bones, and find out what happened to these people and how they died. In the first edition, five bodies dating from the Bronze Age are found in a deep pit on the Isle of Thanet in Kent. One of them is an old woman, who has been manipulated into a position where she is pointing at something. But at what? And why?

programme.desc: Biochemist and author Yewande Biala reveals how she has yet to experience an orgasm, a fact apparently true of one in eight women. Brought up in a strict Catholic family, Yewande struggled with anxiety and shame about sex and she didn't find out that women could have orgasms until she was 19 or 20. Here, she meets other women, scientists and therapists to hear their stories, research and advice. The former Love Island contestant sets out to learn everything there is to know about the complexity of the female orgasm in a bid to experience one for the first time

programme.title: Susan Calman's Grand Day Out
programme.desc: The comedian aboard her vintage camper van, explores the mountainous region of north-west England and the Lake District. She begins her 142-mile journey just south of Penrith, travelling down through the lakes, before heading west to finish near Keswick. Along the way she meets the people and visits the places that make this most scenic part of Britain unique. On Ullswater, Susan gets a chance to take charge of the oldest working passenger vessel in the world, the Lady of the Lake. Then she hears of Beatrix Potter's love of the region before heading the spooky Muncaster Castle

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: The latest reports

programme.title: World's Most Scenic Railway Journeys
programme.desc: A trip through Devon to the tip of Cornwall, going back in time to recapture the golden age of luxury train travel. Travelling in the elegantly restored Statesman, passengers relax in its vintage carriages and enjoy the exquisite service. The first stop is on the stunning Devon coast, which suffered devastating destruction during the heavy winter storms of 2014. From Dawlish, it heads to Cornwall and across the Royal Albert Bridge, a masterpiece of railway engineering

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: The latest reports

programme.title: Dorset: Country and Coast
programme.desc: A visit to Poole Quay, where visitors have the opportunity to view pristine miniature steam engines, all competing for the title of 'best in show'. The programme also looks back on the story of a whale that washed up beside Boscombe Pier in Bournemouth in 1897, and how the skeleton was erected on the pier to attract crowds in the years that followed. Finally, the programme follows the work of Poole Harbour patrol officers, who spend their days on the water, making sure boats and jet skis observe the harbour speed limit, escorting larger vessels into and out of the harbour, and ensuring everything runs safely and efficiently

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: The latest reports

programme.title: The 1970s Supermarket
programme.desc: How supermarkets battled it out with price cuts and clever advertising campaigns as they fought to offer customers the best bargains, including the launch of the iconic ASDA price tap adverts. Elsewhere in the kitchen, chef Rustie Lee puts SMASH to the taste test against home-made mashed potato, and there's also a look back at the launch of one of the most iconic advertising mascots in history, the Honey Monster

programme.title: 999: Critical Condition
programme.desc: Thirty-eight-year-old Lesley is rushed in when her heart stops while she is driving to work, leaving Dr Morris battle to resuscitate her and investigate why a normally fit and well woman with no known medical problems would suffer such an attack. Abigail, aged 20, is treated for a painful neck injury caused by a riding fall, and 28-year-old Laura is brought in having a severe asthma attack. It is clear to Dr Fawcett she is deteriorating fast and that her heart could stop at any moment

programme.title: Motorway Cops: Catching Britain's Speeders
programme.desc: PCs Matt Turner and Ian Cosgrove head to the scene of a collision in Middlewich, where an 11-year-old child has been hit by a van. As the child is taken to hospital by an air ambulance, Matt and Ian start their investigation to figure out what happened. On the M56, PC Rowan Burt is searching for a driver wanted for unpaid speeding fines. When he finally catches up with the suspect vehicle, he's surprised to find it's a police car

programme.title: Shoplifters & Scammers: At War with the Law

programme.title: Cruising with Jane McDonald
programme.desc: The singer sails the Danube on one of the most luxurious ships of its type, as she makes her first foray into the realms of the river cruise. Beginning in Budapest, Jane heads to the Szechenyi Baths, where she indulges in a game of chess. Afterwards, a visit to the Second World War memorial Shoes on the Danube Bank, leaves her in tears. Heading onwards to Vienna, the presenter is all set to meet a real-life princess. Then, after a waltz and a wurst, Jane makes her way to her final stop of Passau, southern Bavaria, to view its charming architecture

programme.title: Great Artists
programme.desc: Tim Marlow presents the life and work of the Western world's most gifted artists, beginning with Giotto di Bondone, the son of a Tuscan shepherd. Born in 1267, Giotto began his apprenticeship at the age of 12, and with his naturalistic treatment of medieval Christian iconography, was recognised as the first in a line of great painters and architects who contributed to the Italian Renaissance

programme.title: Divine Designs
programme.desc: Paul Binski investigates the period after the Second World War, which saw the birth of a modern style of ecclesiastical architecture. He visits Coventry and Chichester cathedrals to highlight the contemporary designs

programme.title: Susan Calman's Grand Day Out
programme.desc: The comedian ventures east of the Pennines on a 126-mile journey that begins at the North Yorkshire village of Runswick Bay, where she goes hunting for a rare gemstone called Whitby Jet. Susan samples the local cod and chips before exploring the gothic ruins of Whitby Abbey - famed for inspiring some of the most dramatic scenes in Bram Stoker's Dracula. After a spell at Mother Shipton's Cave - the oldest tourist attraction in England - she meets up with a group whose members reconstruct Roman gladiatorial battles in York. Finally, Susan ventures to Malham Cove, a huge curving amphitheatre-shaped cliff

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: The latest reports

programme.title: World's Most Scenic Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Cameras focus on a railway that weaves in and out of England and Wales aboard the grande dame of luxury heritage trains, the Northern Belle. This historic adventure charts the story of two ancient nations from Norman times to the industrial revolution. Viewers meet the Fron Choir by Cefn Mawr viaduct and swap wheels for water to travel across the Pontcysyllte aqueduct, a huge stream in the sky. Bill Nighy narrates

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: The latest reports

programme.title: Puzzling with Lucy Worsley
programme.desc: Contestants from Leeds, Pontypool, Norfolk, Belfast, Derbyshire and London take on five rounds of fiendish puzzles as they attempt to qualify for the series' Grand Final. Lucy Worsley asks the questions

programme.desc: The latest reports

programme.title: The Royal Borough: Kensington & Chelsea
programme.desc: At the Chelsea Flower Show the pressure is on horticulturalist Dave Green to create a garden in guest King Charles' honour that also celebrates the late Queen Elizabeth II. Also featured is a party planner to the rich, and a look behind the scenes at the hair salon trusted by Kate Middleton on her wedding day

programme.title: Million Pound Motorhomes
programme.desc: TV presenter Jeff Brazier takes his camper van on an overnight adventure with his friend Paul as they head to Wrexham, where Jeff is reporting on a football match. In Stratford-upon-Avon, Ash and Tom are setting up the Adventure Overland Show in preparation for the arrival of 15,000 people at the motorhome festival over the weekend. Tomi Adebayo tests windbreaks to see which he would invest in, and we get a peek inside a luxurious 2million motorhome that boasts internal wing mirrors, LED lit stairs and an extending couch

programme.title: Skin A&E
programme.desc: Dr Natalia Spierings helps Justin who has a genetic condition which means his skin is covered in lumps made up of nerves. Dr Dev Shah is asked to remove a cyst named Egbert

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Officers Gav and Neil pursue a silver van and a white Toyota believed to have been involved in a raid on a car hire firm, and the van rams the police car. Rob and Spence deal with a man who seems hellbent on unleashing mouthfuls of spit at the cops, while Gav and Dan pull over a dirt bike rider who is cruising the pavements without a helmet

programme.title: PlayOJO Live Casino Show
programme.desc: Interactive gambling

programme.title: World's Most Scenic Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Bill Nighy narrates a trip through Wales' highest peaks and deepest valleys. Starting in Pwllheli in the north west, the route heads along the lines that were built during the slate industry's heyday. At Porthmadog, the journey briefly switches to the reconstructed steam trains of the Welsh Highland National Heritage Railway to Minffordd station. Nearby is the village of Portmeirion, famous for its role in the classic TV series The Prisoner. Rejoining the Cambrian Line, local farmers reveal what the railway means to them, before the route takes in the seaside resort of Aberdovey

programme.title: Cruising with Jane McDonald
programme.desc: The singer heads to Alaska, America's largest state and home to some of the most breathtaking scenery on the planet. She takes a helicopter trip up to an ice field for a dog-sledding adventure, and later witnesses the majesty of the Margery glacier, a 21-mile stretch of ice in the Glacier Bay National Park. On board Holland America's ship Nieuw Amsterdam, Jane goes backstage to meet the cast of the nightly musicals, has a cooking lesson from the executive chef and reveals how to make the most of a lazy day in port

programme.title: Great Artists
programme.desc: Tim Marlow profiles scientist, engineer, inventor and painter Leonardo da Vinci, whose extraordinary artistic genius gave rise to masterpieces including the Mona Lisa, the Annunciation and the Last Supper. Breaking new ground in portraiture and historical imagery, this giant of the Italian Renaissance used his wide-ranging skills to make a unique contribution to the development of European art

programme.title: Divine Designs
programme.desc: Paul Binski visits Liverpool's two cathedrals, which lie at either end of Hope Street. Despite having been built within 60 years of each other they represent starkly contrasting styles, the Anglican edifice being a vast tribute to neo-Gothic design and its Catholic counterpart a typical example of 1960s modernism

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: Milkshake! Monkey's Amazing Adventures
programme.desc: The monkey discovers different types of bridges in Scotland and what they are used for

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: The water in the duck pond mysteriously drains away

programme.title: Gulliver's Travels (2010)
programme.desc: A directionless loser tries to prove himself to the woman he loves by volunteering for a travel writing assignment. He is sent to the Bermuda Triangle, where he ends up stranded on an island populated by miniature people to whom he is a giant. Fantasy comedy, starring Jack Black, Emily Blunt, Jason Segel and Billy Connolly

programme.title: Think Like a Dog (2020)
programme.desc: A 12-year-old tech prodigy's science experiment goes awry and he forges a telepathic connection with his dog. The duo join forces and use their unique perspectives on life to overcome complications of family and school. Family comedy drama, starring Josh Duhamel, Megan Fox and Gabriel Bateman

programme.title: The Wackiest Ship in the Army (1960)
programme.desc: A naval officer is given the command of an old sailing ship to undertake a very important mission - to transport an Australian agent into enemy waters so he can spy on the Japanese. However, he finds the ship is falling apart at the seams and is manned by a crew that does not know how to sail her. Second World War comedy, with Jack Lemmon, Ricky Nelson, John Lund, Chips Rafferty and Tom Tully

programme.title: Picnic (1955)
programme.desc: A drifter turns up in a small American town looking for a well-off old friend in the hope of borrowing money. However, he causes nothing but trouble for the locals, seducing both his old pal's fiancee and a local schoolteacher. Drama based on William Inge's Pulitzer Prize-winning play, starring William Holden, Cliff Robertson and Kim Novak

programme.title: I, Robot (2004)
programme.desc: The inventor of an advanced form of intelligent robot is found dead, and the detective investigating the case is certain that one of the scientist's mechanical creations is responsible - but no one believes his theory because the robots have been programmed to prevent them from harming humans. Sci-fi thriller, inspired by the Isaac Asimov stories, starring Will Smith, Bridget Moynahan and Alan Tudyk

programme.title: Under Siege 2: Dark Territory (1995)
programme.desc: A retired Navy veteran travelling by train is forced to leap into action when he realises terrorist hijackers are on board. Their leader, a vengeful former government operative with access to a powerful orbital weapon, is threatening to set off a chain of earthquakes if his demand for $1billion is not met. Action adventure sequel, with Steven Seagal, Eric Bogosian, Morris Chestnut, Brenda Bakke and Katherine Heigl

programme.title: Anchorman: The Legend of Ron Burgundy (2004)
programme.desc: The chauvinistic host of a top-rated American news programme in 1970s San Diego fights for his status and job security when both are threatened by the arrival of an ambitious female reporter, whose determination to become a newsreader leads to a bitter battle of the sexes. Comedy, starring Will Ferrell, Christina Applegate, Fred Willard and Steve Carell

programme.title: Trading Places (1983)
programme.desc: Two billionaire brothers engineer the downfall of a high-flying stockbroker, while giving a homeless conman all the advantages of wealth, as part of a bet to see whether heredity or upbringing determines character. Comedy, starring Dan Aykroyd, Eddie Murphy, Jamie Lee Curtis, Ralph Bellamy, Don Ameche and Denholm Elliott

programme.title: The SpongeBob SquarePants Movie (2004)
programme.desc: The plucky sea creature sets out to prove his boss Mr Krabs is innocent of stealing Neptune's crown. However, the missing item has ended up in sinister Shell City, which all sea-dwellers fear and from which few have ever returned. Animated comedy, with the voices of Tom Kenny, Bill Fagerbakke, Clancy Brown and Scarlett Johansson, plus a cameo appearance by David Hasselhoff

programme.title: We Bought a Zoo (2011)
programme.desc: A father-of-two struggling to cope with the death of his wife is in need of a fresh start, so buys a house with a dilapidated zoo on the grounds. With the help of the keepers, he works to restore the attraction to its former glory, while also trying to reconnect with his troubled teenage son. Fact-based comedy drama, starring Matt Damon, Scarlett Johansson and Thomas Haden Church

programme.title: Captain Scarlett (1953)
programme.desc: A brave nobleman forms a band of outlaws to free 19th-century French villagers from the tyranny of an evil duke, reclaim his birthright and save a lovely princess from a fate worse than death at the hands of a lecherous count. Swashbuckling adventure, starring Richard Greene, Leonora Amar, Nedrick Young and Manolo Fabregas

programme.title: The Golden Voyage of Sinbad (1974)
programme.desc: A swashbuckling sailor stumbles across a golden tablet that forms part of a map revealing the way to a magic fountain, which is fabled to bestow untold riches and eternal youth. But first the brave mariner has to battle storms, monsters and the trickery of an evil wizard before he can reach his goal. Fantasy adventure, with John Phillip Law, Tom Baker, Douglas Wilmer, Martin Shaw and Caroline Munro, with effects by Ray Harryhausen

programme.title: Secret Headquarters (2022)
programme.desc: Fourteen-year-old Charlie Kincaid yearns for a deeper connection to his father Jack, who frequently disappears at short notice for work. When an IT conference interrupts Charlie's birthday, the teenager invites friends to a party at his father's house, and they stumble upon a subterranean, gizmo-laden lair. Comedy adventure, starring Owen Wilson, Walker Scobell and Michael Pena

programme.title: Jack Reacher (2012)
programme.desc: A former army sniper is arrested following a random shooting that leaves five people dead, but protests his innocence. An elusive former military police investigator is called in to examine the case, and becomes convinced a conspiracy is at work. Action thriller based on Lee Child's series of novels, starring Tom Cruise, Rosamund Pike, Werner Herzog and Robert Duvall

programme.title: Anchorman 2: The Legend Continues (2013)
programme.desc: Arrogant newsreader Ron Burgundy's career is rescued from a drunken slump by an executive for a new 24-hour news channel. Reassembling his team of sidekicks, he swiftly rises from the network's graveyard to become its biggest star with a run of ludicrously sensationalist broadcasts. Comedy sequel, starring Will Ferrell, Christina Applegate, Paul Rudd and Steve Carell

programme.title: Little Fockers (2010)
programme.desc: Nurse Greg is now the proud father of twins, but has yet to earn the respect of his wife's stern father after 10 years of marriage. The couple invite both sides of their extended family to the kids' birthday party, where Greg makes a desperate effort to finally prove his worth to his father-in-law. Comedy sequel, with Ben Stiller, Robert De Niro, Owen Wilson and Dustin Hoffman

programme.title: Madagascar 3: Europe's Most Wanted (2012)
programme.desc: The escaped zoo animals continue their quest to get back to their New York home. Having made it to Monte Carlo, they join a circus on a European tour as a means of travelling undetected - but an animal control agent is in hot pursuit. Animated comedy, with the voices of Ben Stiller, Chris Rock, David Schwimmer and Jada Pinkett Smith

programme.title: Song of the Sea (2014)
programme.desc: The last surviving member of a race of magical seal-children seeks the aid of her human brother for a special quest. The two of them set out on a journey to revive the seal's magical powers and prevent the spirit world from being lost forever. Animated fantasy, with the voices of Lucy O'Connell, David Rawle and Brendan Gleeson

programme.title: Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse (2018)
programme.desc: After being bitten by a radioactive arachnid, student Miles Morales develops incredible abilities, and becomes a version of Spider-Man. When a super collider device opens a gateway to other dimensions, Miles crosses paths with five counterparts to stop a threat for all realities. Oscar-winning animated adventure, with the voices of Shameik Moore and Nicolas Cage

programme.title: Arabian Nights (1942)
programme.desc: The story of two half-brothers - one the heroic caliph, the other an evil usurper - as they do battle for the right to rule their kingdom, and win the hand of beautiful dancer Sherazade. Adaptation of the classic adventure tales, starring Jon Hall, Maria Montez, Sabu and Leif Erickson

programme.title: Star Trek Beyond (2016)
programme.desc: The USS Enterprise sets out on a rescue mission which turns out to be a deadly trap set by a mysterious warlord. The crew are left stranded on an unexplored planet, and join forces with a fugitive alien scavenger to find a way off the hostile world and prevent a terrible weapon being unleashed upon the galaxy. Sci-fi adventure, starring Chris Pine, Zachary Quinto and Idris Elba

programme.title: Inside Man (2006)
programme.desc: A police hostage negotiator is called in when a robbery turns into a siege. The chairman of the bank involved is worried the mastermind behind the heist is set to disclose secrets he needs to stay hidden, so he enlists the help of a political fixer. However, the elaborate nature of the thief's plan looks set to keep him one step ahead of the law, and causes problems for the detective assigned to rectify the situation. Spike Lee's thriller, starring Denzel Washington, Clive Owen, Jodie Foster, Christopher Plummer, Willem Dafoe and Chiwetel Ejiofor

programme.title: No Way Out (1987)
programme.desc: A navy officer unwittingly has an affair with a politician's mistress, and becomes involved in the investigation after she is murdered. However, he soon suspects the plan is to find a scapegoat rather than the real killer - and that he is the most likely candidate to take the fall. Political thriller, starring Kevin Costner, Gene Hackman, Sean Young, Iman and George Dzundza

programme.title: Jackie (2016)
programme.desc: Following the assassination of her husband, President John F Kennedy, Jacqueline Kennedy battles with grief and trauma to regain her faith, console her children, and define JFK's legacy. Director Pablo Larrain's Bafta-winning drama, starring Natalie Portman, Peter Sarsgaard and Greta Gerwig. Mica Levi provided the Oscar-nominated score

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: With Charlie struggling, Shing Lin decides she should move back into Dave's place. Meanwhile, Sharon has a reminder for Felix, and Rayne gets what she wants

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: A proposition from Felix takes Mercedes by surprise, Darren turns to Scott for help with Charlie, and Ethan asks himself whether the scheming is really worth it

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Southbridge, Massachusetts, where he checks into the Vienna Inn, an Austrian-themed hotels and restaurant. Owners Jonathan and Lisa Krach have seen their cluttered inn acquire a negative reputation among the locals, and as a result, business isn't what it used to be. Can Gordon turn things round and keep the doors to this historic hotel open?

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Part one of two. Gordon Ramsay heads to Harpers Ferry in West Virginia, where he tries to save the Town's Inn, a historic hotel run by retired teacher and junk hoarder Karan Townsend. She has accumulated so many useless belongings that there is hardly any room to accommodate guests. Can Gordon convince her to get rid of her clutter or will the hotel continue to go down the pan?

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: When Mary bans Sheldon from reading a comic book that she considers to be too mature for him, the youngster decides it's time to stop living under his mother's thumb

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: When Sheldon is no longer academically challenged at Medford High School, he audits a college class taught by his pen pal Dr John Sturgis. Wallace Shawn and Michael Cudlitz guest star alongside Iain Armitage

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Jake is excited to work a case with the best detective in the NYPD, Dave Majors - until his colleague shares his intentions to ask Amy out on a date. Rosa's surprising fashion choice causes a stir, and Charles and Gina make an unexpected discovery. Comedy, with Andy Samberg

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Holt begins to worry he is being set up for a fall by one of his superiors, and Peralta is handed the chance to work on an important case. Meanwhile, Jeffords tries to make sure his twins get a place at their chosen school. Comedy, with Andy Samberg and Terry Crews

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The gang members get together to have their family photo taken, with Gloria on hand to organise everyone. and Phil tracks down the record he lost his virginity to, but soon regrets it when it makes him feel as if he's being unfaithful to Claire. She, meanwhile, accuses Cameron of being a snob when he refuses her daughter's hand-me-downs, and Jay enters Stella into a dog show

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Mitch and Cam worry about the growing cost of their wedding, so they agree to each sell a prized possession to earn some extra cash. Jay, Gloria and Manny challenge one another to step outside their comfort zones, involving traditional sausages, pickle and Stella's belly, while the Dunphy kids are in a mischievous mood after finding an old answering machine recording of Claire breaking the news that she's pregnant

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny gets the opportunity to spend time with Bill Gates at work, because his business wants to partner with her pharmaceutical company. Leonard, Howard and Raj do everything in their power to also meet the high-tech entrepreneur, while Sheldon thinks he's the victim of an April Fool's Day prank

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
