programme.desc: Another selection of B&B owners take it in turns as hosts to decide which of their establishments provides the best value for money. The contest begins at Dunsandles Guest House in New Brighton, Merseyside, where owner Alan Johnson and his professional sidekick Dave Owen hope to win the title - but a scandal with some unwanted hair on the bed sheets is not a good start, and two guests feel they are making an exhibition of themselves with a tea-trolley in full view of the neighbours

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: On the second day of the competition, the contestants visit the Lady Teal Hotel Boat on the waterways near Burnley in Lancashire, and owners Nick and Gina Mead hope to impress them with an afternoon of entertainment out on the locks. At breakfast, one of the guests admits to not enjoying his stay

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: From York House in Tetbury, Gloucestershire, where Brock Bergius hopes that his cheeky sense of humour and perfectionist nature will help him win the competition. He is in his element making saucy jokes during an afternoon of sausage making, but his reluctance to stray from the menu at breakfast leaves some of his guests disappointed

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition heads to Heyford House in Oxfordshire, where Leo and Sonya Brooke-Little hope to impress the contestants with their hospitality. The afternoon event is boxing, which Brock Burgius sees as the perfect opportunity to settle some scores with his fellow competitors

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The week's winner is announced as the B&B owners meet for the last time to thrash out their differences. Feedback includes criticism of a badly positioned tea tray, controversy over a hot chocolate and accusations of overenthusiastic hosting

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer meet Alex and Danny Moore in Preston, and offer the pair advice on whether they should renovate their home or put it on the market. Danny wants to do up the property and sell it on, but Alex has other ideas, and thinks the house is the perfect place for them to start a family

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: A power struggle unfolds as young chimp Carlos challenges dominant male Dylan, and Asian short-clawed otter Wallace is struck down by a mystery illness. Meanwhile, bush dog Franco's pack has stopped growing after his most recent litter died, and keepers hope that moving one of the breeding females to another zoo might solve the problem

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: A Liverpool family face a difficult decision choosing which one of a litter of 10 German shepherd puppies to take home with them. The Woodgreen staff also hope a Staffordshire bull terrier, brought in by social services after an incident in its previous home, will be able to find a more understanding owner, and a Yorkshire terrier with a big attitude tries to win over a couple

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets a master craftsman whose dream is to build a castle in rural Devon made entirely of mud. Kevin McCabe plans to form the huge property out of two vast curved roundhouses - the largest of which is inspired by the natural geometry of a snail shell - connected by glazing and topped with wildflower meadow roofs to mirror the surrounding countryside. However, the project involves mixing and laying a mind-boggling 2,000 tons of cob, all during warm, sunny weather - and the sheer scale of the task soon becomes clear

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Hospital staff at Queen's Medical Centre in Nottingham treat three female university students who have been victims of a spate of needle-spiking attacks. Twenty year-old Kate is rushed in after collapsing in a nightclub and having to receive CPR from a friend when she stopped breathing normally. In the Urgent Treatment Unit 19 year-old Pavni and 21-year-old Sarah meet while waiting for treatment after what they suspect to be needle-spiking. While being treated Pavni talks about the racist abuse she faced growing up and Sarah reveals the impact COVID-19 has had on her university experience

programme.title: Rescue: Extreme Medics
programme.desc: How the Scottish Trauma Network brings life-saving treatment to remote areas over 30,000 square miles of land, where easy access to hospitals is not always possible. In this opening episode, a trauma team leave Glasgow by helicopter to a remote part of Skye for a man trapped under a 650kg all-terrain vehicle, while a 51-year-old cyclist has a head-on collision with a digger bucket in rural Aberdeenshire

programme.title: The Emergency Ward
programme.desc: Dr Mark tries to help a car crash patient under police guard, but he seems to be hiding something suspicious in his underpants. Dr Miriam examines a cheerful 82-year-old biker with fractures, who suddenly takes a turn for the worse

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Among those arriving at King's College Hospital is 56-year-old Malcolm, who is put on life support after a cardiac arrest. Nightclub host Phil, 36, receives treatment for chronic pain in his back and side, and realises his party lifestyle is taking its toll, while medics discover 61-year-old Bob has suffered a stroke. Doctors also see to Kamilla, 12, who has been knocked down by a car on a pedestrian crossing

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: A woman collapses in the street while out shopping and may have broken her hip, while a man threatens to take an overdose if the paramedics do not take him to hospital

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Hospital staff at Queen's Medical Centre in Nottingham treat three female university students who have been victims of a spate of needle-spiking attacks. Twenty year-old Kate is rushed in after collapsing in a nightclub and having to receive CPR from a friend when she stopped breathing normally. In the Urgent Treatment Unit 19 year-old Pavni and 21-year-old Sarah meet while waiting for treatment after what they suspect to be needle-spiking. While being treated Pavni talks about the racist abuse she faced growing up and Sarah reveals the impact COVID-19 has had on her university experience

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Karen and John Leonard from Essex are close to retirement and fancy a new home in sunny Gran Canaria. Scarlette Douglas shows them five properties for their 175,000 budget

programme.title: Kirstie's Handmade Treasures
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp visits Manhattan, where she creates candy canes and lollipops at artisan sugar crafter Papabubble, before heading back to the UK to learn how to make passion fruit marshmallows covered in chocolate and coconut

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Paul and Kelly, who run a pub-restaurant in Co Durham, want to soak up the sun and grow their own fruit and veg at their very own holiday home on the Greek island of Kefalonia. Danni Menzies shows them what their 120,000 can secure

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: A glampsite owner in Italy battles a busy summer season with no staff. In France, a family from Manchester face challenges as they juggle their family life and holiday home

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien visit Gloucestershire to meet Bryan, who's been collecting everything and anything since childhood. Henry upcycles some old oxygen regulators into bedside lamps, while Simon settles for restoring a stylish and traditional wooden dresser

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien travel across the UK to find unique and valuable items languishing in people's homes and use creative thinking and elbow grease to fix them up to turn a profit for their owners. Here they unearth a church pew, create a fish tank from scrap and uncover a special petrol tank

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The search for beneficiaries in two cases reveals the tale of Second World War desert soldiers, who did battle with more than just enemy fire, and the excitement of early film societies and amateur movie-makers. Later, details of unclaimed estates are disclosed

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition heads to Anglesey, where best pals Richard Tuke and Susan Hatch hope to show that Blackthorn Farm B&B, which they own, is better than any of their guests' establishments. However, they find that their close friendship is scrutinised even more than their property

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The White Swan Hotel in Yeadon, West Yorkshire, is the second stop of the competition, and owners Graham and Barbara Yellow hope their basic facilities and affordable prices will please their guests. Spiritual couple Malcolm and Fiona Piers-Taylor get good vibes from their room, Rachel Lonergan views the hosts in a new light and breakfast is well received by the contestants, despite having to pay a supplement fee

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Vegetarians Malcolm and Fiona Piers-Taylor host at the Old Mill House B&B in Bridport, Dorset, and both come under attack at dinner when Malcolm voices his opinions on meat eating. In the morning, a meditation session gets a mixed response, and most of the guests are left cold by the vegetarian buffet breakfast

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Rachel and Dan Lonergan welcome their guests to the Brighton Inn, East Sussex, where they hope to offer a luxury, boutique experience. Malcolm and Fiona Piers-Taylor give their room a thorough inspection, before the groups learns the art of building a human pyramid in the afternoon's activity. At breakfast, they discover a lack of vegetarian alternatives, and the hosts suspect game-playing when they are shocked by some negative feedback

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners come together to confront their rivals and find out how much they have been paid. Richard and Susan are keen to tackle the bathroom issues of Barbara and Graham, who bask in the comments from Malcolm and Fiona. The Old Mill House proprietors defend their vegetarian breakfast routine, but serve up snobby feedback to Rachel and Dan from the Brighton Inn

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer meet the Farhalls in Windsor, who are unsure whether to sell their four-bedroom detached house or transform the layout of their home. Graham loves living in Windsor but Nardeth is growing tired of their cramped and dated house, and would prefer to look for a new property they could purchase

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Young meerkat parents Huskie and Beagle have a new baby, Junior, but keepers have to step in when he falls gravely ill. Meanwhile, red panda Nima, who lost her partner last year, meets a new mate, Koda, but the pair do not get off to the best start, and in the penguin pool, a new male called Flounder arrives

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Excitable French bulldog Buddy arrives at the centre. His owners have tried selling him seven times but every time he has been rejected. Can the staff finally find him a forever home? An eight-year-old girl who always wanted a small dog has her mind changed when she sees stray labrador Leah, and nervous collie Kimmie needs another dog to keep her company

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows the progress of private chef Ed Versluys and pilates instructor Vicky Anderson, who want to convert a concrete cowshed in the Somerset countryside into a three-bedroom home. With the help of one young builder and the knowledge they can learn from the internet, the couple plan to project manage the conversion themselves. However, they have only eight months and a budget of just over 200,000 to make a warm and comfortable home with straw bale walls and wide expanses of glass

programme.title: The Duchess and Her Magical Kingdom
programme.desc: The Duchess hopes to start a new tradition by hosting the Mr Gay England contest in The Alnwick Garden and works with operations manager Wayne to rework the design for the Lilidorei project. With a projected overspend of 13million, the pair need to cut costs to bring it back within budget

programme.title: The Royals: A History of Scandals
programme.desc: Suzannah Lipscomb is joined by Dr Jennifer Aston, Dr Linda Porter and author Glenn Chandler to discuss the marriage scandal that led to a royal taking the witness box. She also investigates why Charles II was named 'the merry monarch' and uncovers a sex scandal involving a prince and a brothel

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Tensions run high at King's College Hospital when police suspect a patient is concealing a weapon, while maybe mother-of-four Hillary arrives in resus with a severe head injury after falling from her horse. Icylyn's bloated abdomen baffles the medical team and she has to wait overnight for a diagnosis, and 14-year-old Chloe receives treatment following her involvement in a fight

programme.title: The Duchess and Her Magical Kingdom
programme.desc: The Duchess hopes to start a new tradition by hosting the Mr Gay England contest in The Alnwick Garden and works with operations manager Wayne to rework the design for the Lilidorei project. With a projected overspend of 13million, the pair need to cut costs to bring it back within budget

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: A woman who has taken drugs and is hallucinating causes a challenge at a hotel, and a worried mother rings for help when her child is feverish and unable to speak. There are fears of Covid-19 with a patient who is short of breath and has a temperature

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Tensions run high at King's College Hospital when police suspect a patient is concealing a weapon, while maybe mother-of-four Hillary arrives in resus with a severe head injury after falling from her horse. Icylyn's bloated abdomen baffles the medical team and she has to wait overnight for a diagnosis, and 14-year-old Chloe receives treatment following her involvement in a fight

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Anne Hogarth first fell in love with Lanzarote over a decade ago and now, after several visits to the island since, is looking for a holiday home to enjoy in her retirement. With her daughter Rachel along for moral support, Jonnie Irwin shows Anne five properties in the resort of Puerto del Carmen for her 85,000 budget

programme.title: Kirstie's Vintage Gems
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp teams up with potter Richard Miller to help Ellie and Nick Harrington - who have no practical DIY skills - create plates to complement their 1930s-style dining room in Tunbridge Wells, Kent

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Michelle and Bernard from Bolton first visited the stunning Italian city of Lucca a year ago and immediately fell in love with its traditional Tuscan charm and beautiful countryside. The couple now want to buy a holiday home in a nearby town or village, which they can enjoy with their whole family. Helping to fulfil their dream is Ben Hillman, who lines up five options up for their 75,000 budget

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: A Birmingham couple start a cooking school with a difference in France. A glampsite owner in Italy finds a potential pot of gold on her land and a Staffordshire couple have a devastating start to their new life in Spain

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien travel Britain searching for items to fix up and flog for their owners. In East Sussex and Hertfordshire, the duo's finds include a Victorian egg incubator

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien travel to the West Midlands and London, where finds include a potato oven and an old petrol pump

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: A simple case becomes complicated when family secrets are uncovered, while another reveals a great-grandfather's life on the docks in the early days of diving. An uncle's part in the defeat of Nazi Germany in the Second World War is also highlighted. Plus, details of unclaimed estates where heirs still need to be traced

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition heads to Charing, Kent, where landlady Natalie Palmer hopes to show that her B&B, The Oak, is better than any of her guests' establishments. Everything starts off well when a couple are delighted to have enough room for their yoga mats, but the rest of the party are unimpressed with the extractor fans

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants visit the White Lady in Worstead, Norfolk, on their second night, where proprietor Dennis Gilligan tells his guests about a spooky presence that resides there. The guests get competitive in a round of clay shooting, and debate whether they believe in the existence of ghosts

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to Cranleigh House B&B in Combe Martin, Devon, where former couple Katherine Armitage and Stewart Johnston offer alternative accommodation for those who enjoy yoga and are seeking spiritual enlightenment. They hope the group will send out energy for world peace and healing, but Mike and Denise question whether the whole thing is a joke

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Mike and Denise Mitchell welcome the contestants to Beaches B&B in Paignton, Devon, which only opened for business a few weeks ago. Fellow competitor Katherine puts the owners through their paces at breakfast when she asks for something off the menu, and the hosts are pleasantly surprised at feedback time

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners come together for one last time to discover what they have been paid, and the identity of the winner. The Oak owner Natalie wants to know why some of her guests were not enthused by her extractor fans, but she herself receives aggression from Dennis over her criticism of the White Lady. Katherine and Stuart defend their vegetarian breakfast, and Mike and Denise deal with negative comments about their cereal selection

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer visit the Payne-Durkins, on the rural outskirts of Leeds, to help Karl and Paul decide whether to renovate or sell their three-bedroom home. Karl loves the unique design and idyllic location, but Paul thinks they are too isolated, and would rather move to another area than spend the moving improving their current home

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Tortoises Burt and Terrance become rivals in love when they pursue a breeding female. Meanwhile, six-year-old okapi K'Tusha nears the end of her first pregnancy, and keepers hope that her baby will help to conserve this highly endangered species, and Asian elephant bull Aung-Bo senses that the three-day window for mating is about to begin

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Curious four-month-old terrier puppies Bobo and Lenny start scouting out their new surroundings at the centre. The brother and sister are completely different in looks and personality, but both need a forever home. Meanwhile, the staff bring together 82-year-old Alan and lhasa apso Ruby, both of whom are looking for comfort after losing a loved one

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows Lysette and Nigel Offley, who are knocking down an old Thames boathouse and constructing a cutting-edge home in its place. Taking inspiration from the river itself, they have designed a building of waves and curves with a huge glass porthole for a roof light. But problems begin almost from the start, as they cannot find a contractor willing to build over the water, their architect leaves unexpectedly and the costs turn out much higher than expected. To make matters worse, the neighbours are not happy about such a radical sight in their traditional community. As they begin to compromise, Kevin wonders if the couple's dreams will ever be realised

programme.title: My Floating Home
programme.desc: Retired customs officer Keith has been living and working in New Zealand for 25 years. Now, he wants to return to the UK for part of the year and go touring the waterways of the UK with his wife Pam. He's commissioning a brand-spanking-new semi-cruiser narrowboat complete with all the latest gadgets. However, Keith has never owned a boat before, let alone skippered or crewed a narrowboat, so he needs to learn very quickly

programme.title: Grand Designs Australia
programme.desc: Peter Maddison meets Dr Shiva Gunapu and his psychologist wife Rima, who moved from India to Australia 15 years ago. Incorporating the rich colours of their Indian heritage is an essential element for their new home in Norwood in Adelaide, which they've spent three years designing

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Sister Jen is on duty in resus looking after 48-year-old Bobby, who has been suffering from seizures at home. Bobby has spent most of his adult life in prison for a number of violent crimes including murder. Meanwhile, 70-year-old Ronald had to cut short his 46th wedding anniversary celebrations after experiencing breathing difficulties, and Rienelle, seven, receives treatment after falling from the top of a climbing frame at school

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Paramedics treat a man who is in cardiac arrest. They fight to keep him alive while next door his wife hopes for a miracle, on their wedding anniversary. There are reports of a 16-year-old who has collapsed by a canal. Paramedics can see a light being waved at them, but in the dark it's not easy to find their patient. Plus, a mother calls 999 when her three-year-old is struggling to breathe

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Sister Jen is on duty in resus looking after 48-year-old Bobby, who has been suffering from seizures at home. Bobby has spent most of his adult life in prison for a number of violent crimes including murder. Meanwhile, 70-year-old Ronald had to cut short his 46th wedding anniversary celebrations after experiencing breathing difficulties, and Rienelle, seven, receives treatment after falling from the top of a climbing frame at school

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Ex-RAF officers Simon Stenning and Amanda Butcher have been visiting the Caribbean island of Antigua for several years, and now hope to find the perfect winter home there. Ben Hillman helps the pair, showing them five properties for their 330,000 budget

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Driving Wars
programme.desc: Two teams of bikers go head to head in challenges using remotely operated cars. Colin Murray hosts

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard Hammond is dropped into the remote, frozen wastes of Canada to test a watch with a built-in emergency beacon. The distress signal is sent directly to Jeremy Clarkson and James May, who get their hands on two machines and set off on an epic adventure to find their colleague. Plus, Jeremy puts the new 471bhp Lexus RC F coupe thought its paces, while The Fall and The X-Files star Gillian Anderson takes to the track in the Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles and the team come to the aid of a couple in Halifax, West Yorkshire, whose eight-year-old son is paralysed and can only access two rooms in their house. The family home is in need of a major overhaul but with only nine days to complete the job, the gang needs help - and that's where local tradesmen and other members of the community come in, turning up in force to bring designer Gabrielle Blackman's ideas to life

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: The Royal Highland Fuslier, a 100-ton Deltic diesel engine, must be hauled from Leicestershire to Wirksworth in Cheshire

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: The culinary expert is in Falmouth, where he enjoys dishes prepared by an innovative chef called Andy Tuck. Rick also meets Judy, the daughter of acclaimed author William Golding

programme.title: Rick Stein's French Odyssey
programme.desc: The chef's epic journey from the Atlantic to the Mediterranean comes to an end as he takes the final leg of his gastronomic tour along the canal systems of southern France. Arriving in Marseille, he samples seafood and regional cuisine, as well as showing a variety of traditional recipes. He also cooks roast black bream and finds time to send Chalky a postcard

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Host Sean Kelly oversees UK bidders battling to win potential treasures found in Nottingham's storage containers, lock-ups and garages

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: US host Sean Kelly oversees UK bidders in Essex battling to win potential treasures found in storage containers, lock-ups and garages

programme.title: Building Cars: Secrets of the Assembly Line
programme.desc: IPart one of two. James May, Kate Humble and Ant Anstead broadcast from inside Mini Plant Oxford, one of Britain's biggest and busiest car factories, where a new car drives off the production line every 68 seconds. James looks at the use of robotic technology and investigates the claim that British manufacturing is dead, while Ant explores the history and heritage of one of the most iconic cars ever built, and Kate reports on the use of electric cars in Norway

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The presenters try to impress Oxford residents by building an electric car, and refuse to let an unenthusiastic response deter them from sitting in on the machine's crash-test before handing it over to the Stig's environmentally friendly cousin. Actor Michael Sheen is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car, and Jeremy Clarkson pits the Corvette ZR1 against the Audi R8 V10

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard Hammond is dropped into the remote, frozen wastes of Canada to test a watch with a built-in emergency beacon. programme.title: Cannonball
programme.desc: Andrew Flintoff hosts the action-packed game show, in which 24 contestants are tasked with traversing a series of water-based challenges and custom-made inflatable obstacles, each designed to test their speed, accuracy, height and distance. The most successful contestants then claim a chance to launch themselves 'cannonball-style' at a moving target on the surface of a deep-water tank, all in the hope of nabbing the show's 'priceless' Cannonball Cup. Frankie Bridge, Radzi Chinyanganya, Ryan Hand and Maya Jama all join Andrew at the poolside to commentate on the action

programme.title: Total Wipeout: Freddie & Paddy Takeover
programme.desc: Freddie Flintoff and Paddy McGuinness provide the voiceover for classic editions of the adventure game show. Twenty brave men and women throw caution to the wind as they tackle a series of crazy obstacles - including the famous bouncy red balls - in a bid to make it through to the final three and the chance to win 10,000. In this episode, the contestants include a pest controller, a slam poet and a train signaller

programme.title: Rick Stein: From Venice to Istanbul
programme.desc: The chef continues his gastronomic road trip from Venice to Istanbul taking in the countries of the former Byzantine Empire - a renowned melting pot of East and West. This instalment finds the gastronome in the city of Ravenna, where he discovers Piadinas, a thin Italian flatbread street food dating back to Roman times. He then crosses the Adriatic Sea to Croatia - a first for Rick - and a gets a chance to discover new a wealth of dishes such as pasticada, goat stew with peas and lamb peka

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Reeta Chakrabarti, Olga Koch, Andrew Maxwell and Gareth Thomas take part in the game show, hosted by Richard Osman

programme.desc: Richard Osman hosts as BBC Breakfast's Naga Munchetty, singer Jordan Stephens, actor Sally Lindsay and comedian David O'Doherty test their general knowledge

Rob Brydon chairs as the contestants try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Guests Phill Jupitus, Holly Walsh and Nish Kumar join regular panellist Alan Davies and host Sandi Toksvig to contemplate the theme 'nonsense' in an extended episode. programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Jo Brand hosts an extended edition of the satirical news quiz, with regular team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton

programme.desc: Patrick's parents are in town for his surprise party, but end up getting a surprise of their own. Alexis drags Moira to a soap opera convention. Sitcom, starring Noah Reid

programme.desc: Dave Gorman focuses on the role faith plays in modern life as he performs a series of witty stand-up shows

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: James May straps into a highly tuned hatchback as he competes in a world rallycross race, with Top Gear USA host and professional driver Tanner Foust teaming up with him. Jeremy Clarkson puts the latest Jaguar F-type R and Eagle's modernised E-type the Low Drag GT though their paces, while Richard Hammond is in Spain to test the new version of the Mazda MX-5. Plus, X-Men: First Class star Nicholas Hoult takes to the track in the Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Since his wife died shortly after giving birth to their sixth child, Paul Makings has been valiantly holding the family together as they grieve. But he's facing even more problems - living in a two-bedroom house he has started to extend, and forced to sleep on the sofa. Nick Knowles and the team are joined by more than 100 locals in Misterton, Nottinghamshire, as they take on their biggest home build ever. However, they have to battle against a blizzard to complete the job in nine days

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: A legendary diesel locomotive, that's undergone over half a million pounds worth of repairs must be hauled over 40 miles ready for a diesel gala

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: The chef joins a team diving for razor clams, which he takes back to the kitchen to make a quick and tasty dish of grilled shangurro clams. In the Penlee Museum, Rick is shown some of the beautiful items made a century ago by fishermen using Cornish copper, and meets a metalworker who is bringing such wares back to the town

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Following in the footsteps of Turner, one of Britain's most loved artists, Rick discovers how much the Cornish landscape influenced his work. At Newlyn Fish Market, he counts in the daily catch with the head auctioneer, who tells him how the market has adapted to modern times, while at Caerhays Castle, home to the nation's largest collection of magnolia plants, Rick discovers how this corner of Cornwall was once home to some of the great Victorian plant hunters

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Sean Kelly and the bidders are in Alton, Hampshire, where Linda is concerned that the other bidders are taking advantage of her superior knowledge and her looks. Meanwhile, Boudicca and Heavy D form more than just a business partnership, and Barry impresses with his dainty footwork

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Sean Kelly and the bidders head to Poplar, East London, where Heavy D goes through his blue period after driving the other bidders up the wall with his antics

programme.title: Building Cars: Secrets of the Assembly Line
programme.desc: James May, Kate Humble and Ant Anstead broadcast live from inside one of Britain's biggest and busiest car factories. In this edition, the team reveals what it takes to build thousands of different cars a day, as a car that started the manufacturing process yesterday drives off the production line for the first time

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and Richard Hammond debate which company has made the greatest number of exceptional vehicles, and James May finds a way of transporting caravans to campsites without inconveniencing other road users. The Top Gear track plays host to a replica of one of the world's most famous rally cars, and broadcaster Chris Evans - some five years before he was announced as the show's new presenter - is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: James May straps into a highly tuned hatchback as he competes in a world rallycross race, with Top Gear USA host and professional driver Tanner Foust teaming up with him. Jeremy Clarkson puts the latest Jaguar F-type R and Eagle's modernised E-type the Low Drag GT though their paces, while Richard Hammond is in Spain to test the new version of the Mazda MX-5. Plus, X-Men: First Class star Nicholas Hoult takes to the track in the Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Cannonball
programme.desc: Andrew Flintoff hosts the action-packed game show, in which 24 contestants are tasked with traversing a series of water-based challenges and custom-made inflatable obstacles, each designed to test their speed, accuracy, height and distance. The most successful contestants then claim a chance to launch themselves 'cannonball-style' at a moving target on the surface of a deep-water tank, all in the hope of nabbing the show's 'priceless' Cannonball Cup. Frankie Bridge, Radzi Chinyanganya, Ryan Hand and Maya Jama all join Andrew at the poolside to commentate on the action

programme.title: Total Wipeout: Freddie & Paddy Takeover
programme.desc: Freddie Flintoff and Paddy McGuinness provide the voiceover for classic clips from the adventure game show. Twenty brave men and women throw caution to the wind as they tackle a series of crazy obstacles - including the famous bouncy red balls - in a bid to make it through to the final three and the chance to win 10,000. In this edition, the contestants include a microbiologist, a PE teacher and a cheerleader

programme.title: Rick Stein: From Venice to Istanbul
programme.desc: The chef continues his journey through Croatia and savours the native oysters of Ston, before crossing the border into Albania, where he is joined by his son Jack and the pair sample local dishes such as chicken jufka and kokoretsi. In his own kitchen on the Greek island of Symi, Rick cooks traditional Albanian dishes, including Lepur Comlek and Tave Kosi

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Reeta Chakrabarti, Olga Koch, Andrew Maxwell and Gareth Thomas take part in the game show, hosted by Richard Osman

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Guests Matt Lucas, Jerry Springer and Cariad Lloyd join regular panellist Alan Davies and host Sandi Toksvig to contemplate the theme 'noodles' in this extended episode. programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles and the team come to the aid of Manchester couple Rebecca and Steve, whose life was changed for ever when they found out they were expecting triplets. Two years on, Rebecca is becoming depressed by the state of their small, damp, dilapidated house, which is unsafe for the children. The builders have just nine days to bring the property up to date and give this tired mum and dad the space they need for their active offspring. Luckily, local tradespeople and other members of the community turn out in force to help

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: The Train Truckers are on the clock this week as they attempt to move a 100-ton diesel engine to a gala extravaganza, as well as a 175-ton rail crane destined for Egypt

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: On the banks of the River Tamar, Rick visits a little-known mausoleum with a rather macabre story and takes to the waves with an inspirational organisation who offer therapy using the power of surfing. On the wild Atlantic coast, near Bedruthan Steps, he meets fellow chef Emily Scott, who recreates the meal she cooked for President Joe Biden during the recent G7 summit

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: In the town of Looe, Rick discovers a time when the Cornish were taken as slaves by Barbary Pirates. He joins one of the last fishing boats in St Mawes and uses the catch of lemon sole to make a delicious warm salad. In Newlyn, he meets two entrepreneur chefs who are cooking mackerel to perfection

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson puts the Renaultsport Twingo 133 through a stringent examination in Belfast - with a helping hand from actor Ross Kemp. Rick also rolls up his own sleeves to cook his favourite Greek dishes of stuffed peppers and tomatoes and souvlaki

programme.title: WW2 - Battles for Europe

programme.desc: Betrayed, Stalin fights the German army in the Soviet states. The German occupation policies lead to the first extermination policies of 'undesirables'

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels through Bohemia and Bavaria, beginning by exploring the art nouveau architecture of Czech Republic capital Prague. He then samples the sulphurous spa waters and wallows in peat and mud in Marianske Lazne, formerly known as Marienbad, before test driving a state-of-the-art passenger train made at the Skoda factory in Pilsen. Crossing the border into Germany, Michael encounters a fire-breathing dragon in Furth-im-Wald, and learns about an early 20th-century pioneer who laid the foundations for Munich's pre-eminence in science and technology

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Senate House in Bloomsbury, Britain's oldest skyscraper and administrative centre of the University of London. Items under valuation include the hoof of a horse that fought in the Battle of Balaclava, a collection of stained glass panels that were recovered from a skip, and a diamond and platinum bracelet

programme.desc: Derek swaps the office for rain-soaked Ripon to pick up a 1965 Ford Anglia with just 33,000 miles on the clock, while Dave's loving the clean lines of a rare Renault Caravalle

programme.title: Bangers & Cash
programme.desc: Paul heads to County Durham to pick up a 1936 Singer Le Mans sports car and a pristine 1957, one-owner Lambretta LD 150, while Derek gets his hands on a 1962 MGA MK2 Coupe

programme.title: Adolf Hitler's War
programme.desc: As Hitler's troops advance, occupants in Ukraine, Belarus and Poland take the brunt of the occupying forces cruelty; and the first concentration camps are created

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: Documentary uncovering and examining hidden structures built by the Nazis, from tunnels to towers, artillery sites, resistance nests and communication centres. The first edition focuses on the Channel Island of Guernsey, which Hitler occupied and fortified over the course of five years

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on the first leg of a journey to Leeds, beginning at London's Euston station. He finds out what happened to the once proud Euston Arch and heads to Camden to see how goods were transported by rail, road and canal. He reflects on the Harrow rail disaster of 1952 and visits a country estate in Tring, Hertfordshire, before alighting at Cheddington in Buckinghamshire, which is close to the scene of 1963's Great Train Robbery

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey to Leeds by travelling through Buckinghamshire, meeting one of the Second World War's most secret agents at Bletchley. In Olney, he learns about a poet whose words are still sung today, and explores the first purpose-built railway town at Wolverton. His last stop is Newport Pagnell, where he tackles the ancient craft of vellum-making

Heading to Bilbao, he explores the industrial ties between France and Spain and learns to cook a traditional Basque dish

programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team head for the attractive gardens of Trelissick, near Truro in Cornwall. A lifebelt tells the graphic story of a shipwreck off the Lizard peninsula in which the crew were rescued in desperate circumstances

programme.desc: The next part of Michael Portillo's journey from London to Leeds begins in Northampton, where Victorian methods have been used to make shoes for more than 130 years. programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo ventures once more on to the European rail network to retrace journeys featured in George Bradshaw's 1913 publication Continental Guide, beginning by travelling through Russia. He starts in the industrial city of Tula, before visiting Leo Tolstoy's former home of Yasnaya Polyana and learning how the author's life and works were intertwined with the railways. Michael then boards the train that runs from the Caspian Sea to Moscow, where he performs an important role in a dramatic opera at the Bolshoi Theatre, before exploring the beauty and history of St Petersburg and riding on the first railway ever built in Russia

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Ightham Mote, a medieval manor near Sevenoaks. Objects brought in to be valued include a set of hold and porcelain false teeth from the 1850s, which triggers a grim look back at the history of dentures. Plus, Walter Scott's walking cane, and two cricket bats dating back to the 18th century

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud revisits Andy and Nicki Bruce, who were building an experimental amphibious house on a small island on the Thames in Buckinghamshire. They spent 1.2million on one of the most ambitious Grand Designs ever, but the logistical headache of building on an island only accessible by a narrow footbridge soon became clear. Heavy machinery was swept away by the river, contractors were changed, and the site was hit by severe storms, causing delays and resulting in an unfinished and untested building. Kevin returns to find out what living on a regularly flooded piece of land is like, and whether the floating home performed when the river burst its banks in January 2015

programme.desc: The diners get dressed up as celebrities as sales manager Mike, in full Elvis gear, hosts the second evening in south London and serves up three courses of Caribbean cuisine

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: After two raucous evenings, Staar aims to chill her guests out with meditation, crystals and a menu of vegan dishes, hoping her earth mother vibes will put her in pole position

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The week's dinner parties continue to be served in south London. After the chilled-out vibes of Staar's dinner the previous evening, Nesha is keen to up the energy levels and deliver on the high standards of cooking she has been promoting all week. Confident, she goes all-out for her guests, but will it be enough to get her hands on the 1,000 prize?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It's the last night of the fun and games in south London and events manager Rory's turn to host with an Asian-themed menu and a glam-it-up dress code. Competitive sales manager Mike is sure he's in the top spot, but Rory knows his biggest threat is other events manager Nesha - who has been a constant critic over the week. Vegan hippy hairdresser Starr has suffered a rough ride with the food she's been served this week and tonight's no exception when her dessert is a disaster

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: A catch-up with the owners of a luxury B&B that's been affected by the Covid-19 pandemic, as they take on new jobs to secure their future in Spain. Plus, revisits to a couple running a Spanish cycling company who were looking to expand into a new territory and a Nottinghamshire couple who opened a plant nursery in France two years ago

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Pia and Stephen Abbott have been married for 35 years and have long dreamt of owning a property in Spain. Jasmine Harman helps the couple find a home around La Marina Alta within their 130,000 budget

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Lee and Lynn Fox from South Yorkshire have been regular visitors to the Tuscan city of Lucca since Lee's job as a mechanical engineer first took him there over 10 years ago. Lynn's hairdressing business and Lee's job keep the couple very busy, so making the most of their quality time together is key. Laura Hamilton makes it her mission to show them a variety of properties as close to the city centre as possible, on a budget of 170,000

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Gemma Willock hosts the first party in the West Midlands, and her evening of glitz and glamour looks set to be a roaring success until an unwelcome revelation about her corner-cutting approach to the competition threatens her chances of taking the 1,000 prize

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Mortgage adviser Andrew Devey throws the second party in the West Midlands, hosting a beatnik-themed evening. He cooks shepherd's pie for his main course, as well as lining up some pop art in the hope that it will expand his guests' minds

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Vegetarian Jules Evans hosts the third day of the competition in the West Midlands, and plans to indulge her passion for historical re-enactments by planning a medieval-themed dinner. The guests offer mixed responses when they look at the menu, but things take a turn for the better when she announces a duel will form part of the evening's entertainment

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Massage therapist Lucy Hird hosts the fourth dinner party from the West Midlands, featuring an extensive menu full of Thai specialities. She also gives individual presents to her guests, but her night is compromised by the entertainment

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Mental-health nurse Lloyd Cast hosts the final dinner party from the West Midlands. Despite appearing to be an extrovert so far, he decides on a chilled theme for the evening to allow his food to take centre stage, before the winner of the 1,000 is announced

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jean Johansson heads to the glorious Greek island of Crete to help Jeanette and Phil, who are dreaming of starting a new, relaxed way of life in the sunshine while spending more quality time together. They're focusing their search around the beautiful, ancient city of Chania and ideally want a three-bedroom detached house with a pool. They have allocated a budget of 170,000, so Jean hunts out five properties for them to consider

programme.title: A Place in the Sun

programme.title: A Cotswold Farmshop

programme.title: Bake Off: The Professionals

programme.desc: Around 11,000 automatic number plate recognition cameras continually monitor vehicles on Britain's roads. programme.desc: While Leah sympathises with Tegan following Andrew's decision, the latter wrestles with having lied about his choice. Rose plans a romantic surprise for Mali at the farmhouse

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: A young man suffering from severe acne visits the surgery hoping to start a new form of treatment, but there are some serious side effects the doctors need to make him aware of first. programme.title: Casualty 24/7: Every Second Counts

programme.title: Skin A&E

programme.title: Ambulance: Code Red
programme.desc: Two men are injured after an explosion at a firm that specialises in the disposal of hazardous waste. Jay and Paul were both caught in a fireball and have burns on their faces. Jay also has burns on his hands and knees. Dr Katie White and critical care paramedic Karen Baker are immediately dispatched

programme.title: Killer at the Crime Scene
programme.desc: Laureline Garcia-Bertaux is reported missing, and five days later police find a female body buried in a shallow grave in a back garden

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: Emily, a teenage girl with a long history of depression, comes to the surgery to seek advice about the anti-psychotic medication she is currently taking. Also, pensioner Patrick and his wife meet with doctors to discuss his recent behavioural changes and memory loss, hoping the doctors can establish if this is being caused by the onset of dementia

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The wives of two marines are murdered, and although Gibbs initially suspects they were victims of domestic violence, subsequent developments suggest the case may involve professional killers who already have their next victim in mind. Drama, starring Mark Harmon and Cote de Pablo

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team suspects a desperate US Marine may have faked his own death with the help of a friend and blown up an ambulance in a botched attempt to cover all traces of the subterfuge. Subsequent developments, including a mysterious disappearance, seem to confirm the hypothesis - until a timely discovery by Abby throws new light on the case

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The agents are called to a national forest where several women have gone missing and conclude there may be a serial killer at large - a theory confirmed in gruesome fashion as the investigation proceeds. Drama, with Mark Harmon and David McCallum

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: McCoy and Southerlyn arrest a homeless man on suspicion of killing a fellow vagrant and gather enough evidence to bring a prosecution - but a clever defence attorney tries to get him exonerated by arguing that the laws of decent society do not apply to people who live on the streets

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate the murder of a bookmaker whose testimony led to the incarceration of a Mob boss 10 years previously. The trail leads to an apparently reputable businessman with a sideline in contract killing who appears to be taking orders from the Mafia. Police drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Sam Waterston

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate the case of a motivational speaker who died after being pushed from a hotel balcony, and find themselves caught up in a protest against gay adoption laws. Crime drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A woman is accused of murdering her husband's mistress. Although the crime is found to be premeditated, the defendant's lawyer claims his client's actions were prompted by post-traumatic stress syndrome arising from the September 11 terrorist attack. Starring Dennis Farina

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A recently paroled prison gang member is shot dead, and suspicion falls on former crime associates - until his battle behind bars with a corrections officer comes to light. McCoy then learns the defence attorney will claim his client took action to ward off a threat by the con and his 'brotherhood'. Guest starring Candice Bergen

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: McCoy discovers two suicide victims were participating in clinical trials of an experimental antidepressant, prompting him to charge the drug company's CEO with second-degree murder. In court the defence argues all medical research carries an element of risk and the judge rules prosecution evidence inadmissible, leaving the outcome on a knife-edge. Sam Waterston and Dennis Farina star

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A former marine falls to his death from a hotel balcony, and investigations quickly lead to the discovery of another body. As Gibbs and the team dig deeper, they uncover evidence that points to the activities of a vice ring trafficking young girls. Mark Harmon, David McCallum, Michael Weatherly and Pauley Perrette star

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: McGee tries to help his sister, who believes she may have murdered someone - but is too traumatised and disorientated to remember exactly what happened. As the team investigates the connected case of a sailor's death, Tony and Abby find themselves distracted by relationship problems. Drama, starring Sean Murray, Michael Weatherly and Pauley Perrette

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Two FBI agents try to seize control of the team's investigation into the discovery of a perfectly preserved body hidden in a chimney at a marine base. Reluctant to be ousted from the case, Gibbs agrees to work with them - and learns the victim was a serial killer responsible for the deaths of 14 people. Meanwhile, McGee's literary efforts lead to discord with the others

programme.title: Law & Order: Criminal Intent
programme.desc: Nichols investigates the murder of a woman who was left to bleed to death, and must overcome the strained relationship he has with his father - a renowned psychologist - to solve the case when it transpires the killer has multiple personalities. Guest starring F Murray Abraham

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Benson gets caught up in a risky game of cat and mouse when an actress accuses a high-powered media mogul of attempted rape

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Rollins and Fin immerse themselves in learning a new witness interview technique. Meanwhile, Benson works with the victim of a rape

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: DiNozzo investigates a murder at the military academy he once attended, after a murdered marine and alumni of the school is found clutching a photo of a current student. Meanwhile, Bishop and her husband invite the team out for a special dinner. Starring Mark Harmon, Michael Weatherly and Pauley Perrette

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team suspects Gibbs's arch-nemesis is behind an explosion at a summit on global terror. Meanwhile, a grief-stricken Fornell struggles to deal with the fatal shooting of his ex-wife. American drama, starring Mark Harmon, David McCallum, Pauley Perrette and Joe Spano

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: In the final episode of the series, Judge Gary Feldman discovers that McCoy and Ross have indicted an innocent man on charges of rape following an attack on a girl in Harlem. As her life hangs by a thread, the mistake sparks departmental scandal and looks set to ruin Schiff's political career. Jerry Orbach, Sam Waterston and Carey Lowell star

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Curtis think they have stumbled on the work of a serial killer after a woman is found on the cusp of death, having survived days of torture. Briscoe and Curtis are quickly on the case and are shocked to discover a plot involving the victim's own family

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team is called to a high school on a marine base, where a pupil has taken his classmates hostage and is threatening to detonate a bomb strapped to his chest. Gibbs manages to enter the classroom in an attempt to dissuade the boy, but soon realises someone else may be controlling his actions. Drama, with Mark Harmon and Michael Weatherly

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs is called to a frozen lake, where two children have discovered the body of a missing US Marine. The team searches the water for clues and finds three more bullet-ridden corpses, all of which have tattoos linking them to a notorious street gang. The case then becomes a race against time to discover what connects the murders before the serviceman's comrades seek revenge

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs is assigned to examine the apparent suicide of a Pentagon cryptographer suspected of spying. The case is thrown into disarray by the discovery of evidence indicating another person was present at the time of death - meaning the real mole may still be on the loose and has already killed at least once. Crime drama, with Mark Harmon and David McCallum

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A shooting occurs at City Hall leaving a councilman dead and a water inspector injured. Once a suspect is identified, the prosecution has a hard time securing the murder weapon as evidence, as it transpires it was obtained by the FBI in a covert operation. Jerry Orbach stars

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A Gulf War veteran is arrested on suspicion of killing a peace campaigner whose views he opposed because he believed they were anti-American - and cites the recent death of his son in Afghanistan as the cause of his extreme emotional disturbance. Drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: McCoy vows to find those responsible when a key witness to the killing of a drug dealer is shot dead. Suspicion falls on the accused's cousin, a local hoodlum with a number of charges to his name, and another associate who refuses to make a deal with the investigators. Sam Waterson, Elisabeth Rohm and Jerry Orbach star

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Green goes undercover to gather evidence on gun dealers who murdered two detectives during a firearms sting, and McCoy tries to prove a fellow attorney paid the killers to avenge the death of his stepson, who was shot dead in a police operation several years earlier. Crime drama, starring Jesse L Martin and Sam Waterston

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A famous novelist dies after undergoing plastic surgery, leading to the discovery that her surgeon made a crucial mistake by prescribing a drug that should not have been mixed with the antidepressants she was already taking. McCoy suggests the next of kin prosecute in a civil case, but Southerlyn disagrees and hunts for further evidence of malpractice

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The Governor of Connecticut's wife is murdered at a Republican Party function and the investigation leads police to uncover a gay love triangle involving her husband. An arrest is soon made, but a key witness is barred from testifying at the trial because he has entered into a civil partnership with the killer

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team tries to find out who was responsible for sabotaging a robotic vehicle that caused the death of a Navy lieutenant and almost killed Abby. Meanwhile, Ziva's suspicions are aroused by the discovery that Tony is repeatedly visiting the hospital. Drama, starring Pauley Perrette, Michael Weatherly, Cote de Pablo and Mark Harmon

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The discovery of a dead marine intelligence officer in a motel room sets the team off on a hunt for her killer. Although the town's authorities have allegedly already investigated the crime, Gibbs is determined to conduct his own thorough inquiries - which may lead him to a terrorist cell. Drama, starring Mark Harmon

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A marine major is found dead in an underground maintenance room, having scratched out one of his own eyes - and the presence of a webcam suggests someone watched him die. The team investigates with the help of Lt Col Hollis Mann, and links the case to wanted terrorist Mamoun Sharif, an old adversary who is threatening to unleash a chemical attack

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: A scared and emaciated boy is found alone in the Arizona desert and another child is reported missing. During the hunt for a suspected kidnapper, Morgan finds himself revisiting painful memories from his past as he tries to bond with the boy in a bid to locate the other youngster

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A celebrity reveals himself as the victim of a predator targeting men in gay clubs, but as the team investigates the case, a huge twist emerges in his tale

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Rollins comes to blows with the parents of a 13-year-old who has ran away, and a lawyer tries to get the team arrested over her case

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A covert identity created for one of Gibbs' undercover cases 20 years previously resurfaces after a murder victim is found to be using the alias. Meanwhile, Bishop becomes anxious at the thought of having to work incognito in the future. Starring Mark Harmon and Emily Wickersham

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A US Navy lieutenant is murdered at the Defence Logistics Agency, while visitings the office of an admiral currently away at sea. As the team investigates the scene of the crime, they realise a rare painting found in the admiral's office is actually an elaborate fake placed there after the killing, replacing the stolen original. As the quest to locate the missing artwork gets under way, the agents realise they need the help of an expert. Luckily, Tony's con-artist father has returned to town, having broken up with his fiancee, and is on hand to provide expert advice as the hunt for the killer takes them into the shady world of the black market. Guest starring Robert Wagner

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate when a professional escort is shot dead in an alley, and come to believe the real target may have been his date, who escaped with minor injuries. Further probing suggests a strange relationship between the woman and her son, leading to a meeting with a court psychiatrist. Sam Waterston and Jerry Orbach star

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green go in search of a boy's killer - and are shocked when it appears a 10-year-old girl could be responsible. McCoy steps in, claiming she should be committed to a psychiatric hospital before other murders occur. Jerry Orbach stars

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Journalist Nick Wallis joins police forces around the nation to discover how CCTV and technological advances are helping to bring criminals to justice. The programme reveals how essential surveillance cameras have become in the fight against crime and features footage of people caught red-handed

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A suspect dies while being restrained by Ziva, who finds herself accused of using undue force and becomes the subject of an internal investigation. To make matters worse, Jenny is kidnapped by the dead man's brother, who demands a consignment of impounded heroin in exchange for her release. Drama, guest starring Connor Trinneer (Enterprise) and Tamara Taylor (Bones), with Mark Harmon, Cote de Pablo and Lauren Holly

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part one of two. Gibbs is injured in an explosion while conducting inquiries aboard a ship. He lapses into a coma, during which he has flashbacks of the past he has always kept hidden. Meanwhile, Tony takes over the investigation, but his approach begins to cause friction

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part two of two. Gibbs emerges from his coma, but is suffering from amnesia - hindering the team's attempts to unravel a terrorist plot, as he is the only person likely to possess information on the would-be perpetrator's plans. Drama, starring Mark Harmon, David McCallum and Michael Weatherly

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A cross-dresser is suspected of killing and dismembering a cantankerous former boxer - but the team is unable to find vital body parts, making it impossible for the medical examiner to prove the case is murder. Crime drama, starring Jerry Orbach

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A Holocaust survivor is murdered shortly before she is due to testify at the trial of a former SS Officer stationed at a concentration camp, forcing McCoy to consider who stood to gain the most from the old woman's death - the alleged war criminal, or a music producer promoting racist records

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A respected district attorney is found dead in Central Park - and as Briscoe and Green investigate, they discover he was actually living under an assumed identity, and had never graduated from law school. To complicate matters, further inquiries link his murder to that of a journalist 10 years previously. Guest starring Michael Bloomberg

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A notorious radio DJ claims to have survived an attack by two men posing as chauffeurs. Fontana and Green are dubious at first, knowing he has a history of staging bogus assaults on himself, but the discovery that he is having an affair with a mobster's mistress prompts them to investigate further. However, proving the Mafia's involvement depends on a number of unreliable or unavailable witnesses. Dennis Farina and Jesse L Martin star

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A jeweller with ties to the Russian Mob is shot dead in the middle of Times Square. It emerges that he had been helping the authorities bring his associates to justice, giving the detectives some obvious suspects. However, another man injured in the gunfire is later identified as one of the two shooters, bringing his accomplice and then the dead man's wife under suspicion

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Detectives Fontana and Green investigate the murders of a group of heroin users in a raid on a drug den. The prime suspect is a warlord who aided American forces in Afghanistan and claims diplomatic immunity - but McCoy and Southerlyn refuse to be swayed in their attempts to prosecute. Drama, starring Dennis Farina, Jesse L Martin, Sam Waterston and Elisabeth Rohm

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The agents try to track down an arms dealer who has the launch codes for the Navy's encrypted satellite defence system and is offering them to the highest bidder. In an attempt to win the confidence of the buyer, Ducky poses as an ageing Englishman trying to sell the information. Guest starring Armand Assante, with David McCallum and Mark Harmon

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A sailor's body is discovered in a disused restaurant, and his death is initially ascribed to an accidental drug overdose. However, Abby discovers a message written in blood on a laminated card found at the scene and realises he was murdered. Meanwhile, Jimmy continues to pursue a relationship with Agent Michelle Lee

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A nuclear power plant inspector suffers radiation poisoning, forcing the team to consider the possibility that a foreign power deliberately targeted him. As the others investigate, Ziva spends time with the ailing victim - and begins to realise she is developing feelings for him. Drama, guest starring Matthew Marsden, with Cote de Pablo

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Danny's investigation into a man covered in rat bites and thrown from a car leads him to the door of a powerful socialite (guest star Mary Elizabeth Mastrantonio). Meanwhile, Frank looks to turn the tables on a bigoted radio host. Drama, with Tom Selleck and Donnie Wahlberg

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The detectives have their work cut out for them when three major cases all come in at midnight. Meanwhile, Tensions boil over between Rollins and Carisi

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The assault of a teenage girl leads to a shocking discovery. Benson has a short-lived, tragic reunion with someone from her past

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A woman is murdered at the home of Gunnery Sergeant Holt Perkins, and while the victim is initially assumed to be the marine's wife, analysis reveals her to be a convicted thief, presumed to be on the scene as part of a plot to hit Perkins' house. When the agents discover the calling card of notorious terror cell Dragon's Tooth on the body, it becomes clear the murder has been committed as part of a wider agenda, and the team joins forces with the Department of Defence to catch the killer. American drama, starring Mark Harmon, David McCallum, Cote de Pablo and Pauley Perrette

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A prostitute and what seems to be one of her clients are gunned down in a drive-by shooting, and when it emerges that the would-be John was actually a Navy officer, Gibbs and DiNozzo realise the killings are connected Lex Tarlionas, an incomplete operation to bring justice to those responsible for an attack on a US airport in 1979, which left 100 people dead. The main suspect is a former Colombian drugs kingpin known as Tomas Orlando, and the murdered sex worker was about to hand over crucial DNA evidence that could have connected him to the crime, but now that she is dead, Gibbs and the others must find another way to finally bring Orlando in. American drama, starring Mark Harmon and David McCallum

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The conviction of a death row prisoner is called into question by the revelation that attorney-client privilege may have prompted a former prosecutor to withhold evidence capable of establishing his innocence. Drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Steven Hill

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Part two of two. The wealthy and powerful Mulroney family is investigated for links to the Mafia, and Stabler hunts for Helen Katich, the only witness to Brecker's death - but her lifeless body is found in a car pulled from a river. However, the setback leads to a Mob hitman who provides information needed to pursue a case against the family

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Met Police helicopter India 99 is called to help rescue a woman who jumped into the Thames near the Palace of Westminster, as well as her two daughters, who leapt in after her. Elsewhere, the helicopter team coordinates a risky game of cat-and-mouse as police chase a group of graffiti artists across live train tracks in a patch of industrial wasteland in Battersea. programme.title: The Bad Skin Clinic
programme.desc: Dr. Emma Craythorne and her team of experts are on a mission to solve complex skin conditions. They help people whose lives have been impeded by devastating disorders.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress with Tan France
programme.desc: Young bride Ellie wants Tan to find her something sexy for her big day, and Brocarde needs a modest dress to appease her ghostly groom

programme.title: Ghost Adventures
programme.desc: In Seattle, ghost hunters Zak Bagans, Nick Groff and Aaron Goodwin visit a home apparently holding some sort of demonic force. Inscriptions have been written all over its walls, furniture has been turned upside down, glasses have been thrown and fires spontaneously ignited

programme.title: Ghost Hunters
programme.desc: TAPS face a flurry of unexplained activity at a prison-turned-whiskey distillery in North Carolina. The team tap into the facility's tragic past to find answers

programme.title: Ghost Adventures
programme.desc: Ghost hunters Zak Bagans, Nick Groff and Aaron Goodwin visit Texas' Magnolia Hotel, which is said to be haunted by a spirit of a little girl called Itzy

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Animal Cops San Francisco
programme.desc: Neglected parrots are rescued from an abandoned house, and a trapped cat is helped out of a tight spot. Plus, advice on tackling a wild raccoon

programme.title: Dr Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: A dog is rushed into the clinic for treatment after eating a box of chocolates infused with marijuana, while a puppy is rescued from being put down at a shelter in Oklahoma

programme.title: Fantasy Homes by the Sea
programme.desc: Jenni Falconer helps a writer and a musician to find a property with an inspirational sea view in North Devon

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping Feature. Your one-stop-shop for all things cruise; bringing you the hottest destinations, ground-breaking ships and the latest deals to ensure your next cruise is your greatest one

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard goes on a trip to Jersey where he meets the island's biggest hoarder, and at an old manor house, he discovers an estate-made 1950s swing and trapeze

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard buy quirky items in Dorset. Twin sisters show their late father's legacy - vintage cars and steam train memorabilia. Plus, a visit to Luton's oldest hat makers

programme.title: The Saved and Remade Workshop
programme.desc: A wooden chest proves trickier than it looks when Daisy discovers woodworm. Amanda Lamb asks the re-makers to reimagine her husband's old model ship

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Antiques experts Anita Manning and Philip Serrell kick off their final leg in Castle Douglas, Kirkcudbrightshire, and finish at a nail-biting final auction in Crooklands in the Lake District

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore salvages three items from Woking Recycling Centre in Surrey, including a retro two-seater sofa and a vintage sewing box

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Tamsin is looking for her dream holiday home on the Greek island of Crete. She and her best friend Emma, who she has known since meeting at nursery school, have enjoyed many a holiday on the island, and now Tamsin is ready to have her own bolthole there. Laura Hamilton works within her budget of 100,000 to find a suitable property

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: The story of Christina, who has not left her house in two years and needs to make dramatic changes to her life before it is too late

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: Ayesha falls in love with the first dress she tries on, but also loves the second dress as well. Plus, Nichale has another fitting and finds her dress is too small

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: Kristin wants the advice of her friends to help her find the perfect gown. Problems arise when she thinks she has found the one, but her friends do not agree

programme.title: Animal Cops San Francisco
programme.desc: The team tries to break up an illegal cock-fighting ring, while officer Sadler saves a dog from a fire and Johnson takes urgent action against a cruel pet owner

programme.title: Saving Lives at Sea
programme.desc: Volunteers come to the aid of a family trapped in their car on the causeway connecting the Holy Island of Lindisfarne to the mainland, who face being slowly engulfed by the sea. The crew of one of the RNLI's few inland stations in Ireland assists two capsized kayakers just a few days after Christmas, and on Dorset's Jurassic Coast, a fossil hunter is cut off by a rising tide

programme.title: The Edinburgh Auction House
programme.desc: Auctioneer Sybelle Thomson delves through homes in Scotland in search of items she thinks will deliver the goods at auction

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Thomas Plant and Christina Trevanion visit Co Kildare and Dublin, and try to uncover some hidden gems to take to auction in Wrexham

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Auctioneers Christina Trevanion and Thomas Plant travel through North Wales, starting in Ruthin, Denbighshire before heading to auction in Colwyn Bay, Conwy. Christina visits Caernarfon castle, while Thomas finds out about the only ever Welsh Prime Minister David Lloyd George

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Doctor Who star Jodie Whittaker looks into a romantic story about how her paternal grandmother Greta came to be given the middle name of Verdun - which was a First World War battle. On her mother's side, the actress gets to the bottom of how her great-great-grandfather worked his way up from child labourer in a Yorkshire coal mine to becoming the owner of one

programme.title: 24 Hour Baby Hospital
programme.desc: Expectant mum Kayleigh is hoping she will break the family tradition of always having C-section deliveries, while Zosia is determined to have as little intervention as possible in the birth of her first baby. Samantha and Anto arrive at the Rotunda for radical laser treatment in an effort to save the lives of their unborn twins

programme.title: Ghost Adventures
programme.desc: The team investigates Grand Canyon Caverns in Peach Springs, Arizona, which was formerly a sacred Native American burial ground. The boys dodge mysterious rocks thrown at them during the night's lockdown, and Zak Bagins has an eerie, one-on-one encounter

programme.title: Ghost Hunters
programme.desc: TAPS braces for a storm of paranormal activity at the Mississippi Coast Coliseum. Alongside Steve Shippy, they investigate the frightening events shaking employees

programme.title: Motorway Patrol
programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. The series is centred around the roads of Auckland, the country's largest urban area, and features motoring chaos including major traffic collisions, escaped animals and pedestrians on busy roads. There is also footage of drivers falling asleep at the wheel, overloaded vehicles and suspects caught with illegal substances - plus a host of excuses as the people pulled over try to persuade officers they have not done anything wrong

Clues found on the watch lead the crew to a heavily guarded Knights Templar stronghold in France. Sci-fi thriller, starring Eddie McClintock and Joanne Kelly

programme.title: Quantum Leap
programme.desc: Sam becomes a ghostbuster assigned to prevent the prophesied death of a woman apparently haunted by the deranged spirit of her dead husband

However, when Merlin learns the would-be bride has a dark secret, he sets about trying to discover what interest she could possibly have in pursuing a union with Camelot's heir. Fantasy drama, guest starring Miriam Margolyes, with Colin Morgan and Bradley James

programme.title: Star Trek: Voyager
programme.desc: The ship receives a hologram of Lieutenant Barclay, who presents another scheme that could provide a shortcut home, and the Ferengi plot to steal Seven of Nine's nanoprobes. Sci-fi drama, guest starring Marina Sirtis and Dwight Schultz, with Kate Mulgrew and Jeri Ryan

programme.desc: When an airline pilot is shot to death in his home, authorities launch a manhunt that takes a decade to bring the fugitive to justice
