programme.title: Warehouse 13
programme.desc: Pete and Myka are sent to Philadelphia to find an artefact that is the cause of strange hallucinations, while Claudia takes a big risk by attempting to resurrect Steve. Sci-fi thriller, starring Eddie McClintock and Joanne Kelly

programme.title: Quantum Leap
programme.desc: Sam becomes a fraternity member in 1967 and faces the challenge of mending his loose-living ways to prevent a fellow student from starting a potentially fatal anti-war demonstration. Starring Scott Bakula and Dean Stockwell

programme.title: Merlin
programme.desc: Gwen is forced to choose between saving the life of Arthur and her estranged brother Elyan, with one of them set to die at the hands of Cenred. She tries desperately to find a way out, but with Morgana and Morgause doing everything they can to thwart her efforts, the outcome looks bleak. Starring Angel Coulby and Emilia Fox

programme.title: Star Trek: Voyager
programme.desc: When the ship's away team is taken captive, the Doctor's hologram program is unable to function and he is forced to take refuge inside Seven of Nine's body, where he experiences human sensations for the first time. Sci-fi drama, guest starring Megan Gallagher, with Jeri Ryan and Robert Picardo

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: On the eve of his wedding to Rita, and Connor entering witness protection, Pride must find who attacked Jimmy and Connor, while also figuring out Sasha's ulterior motives regarding their son

programme.title: SEAL Team
programme.desc: Following an ambush, the team suspects someone on the inside is leaking information to the cartel. Action drama, starring David Boreanaz

programme.title: Alphas
programme.desc: The Department of Defence asks Rosen and his team to track down rogue Alpha Skylar Adams, whose abilities have made her a skilled inventor. One of her devices has enabled government officials to easily locate other high-functioning individuals, but now they fear she has had a change of heart and wants to lend her talents to a mysterious third party known only as Z. Sci-fi action, guest starring Summer Glau (Terminator: The Sarah Connor Chronicles)

programme.title: Snapped
programme.desc: Detectives investigating the death of an Atlanta-based rapper get a shock when they find horrifying evidence planted by the victim, seconds before his death

programme.desc: Officers deal with a feisty mother from Canterbury, and the Armed Response Unit confronts two youths who are believed to be carrying a gun

Starring Colin Morgan, Bradley James and Katie McGrath, with Donald Sumpter (Being Human)

programme.title: Star Trek: Voyager
programme.desc: After the ship undergoes vital maintenance, Kim finds himself taking his first command as he captains a damaged Kraylor vessel in a humanitarian plan to save the species' world. Sci-fi drama, starring Garrett Wang

programme.desc: Thomas and Higgins' new clients hire them to find their missing brother, leading to one of the duo being shot and TC being abducted when a secret case of revenge is revealed during the investigation. Crime drama, starring Jay Hernandez and Perdita Weeks

programme.desc: When an up-and-coming ballet dancer is mysteriously poisoned, the NYPD dives deep into the rigorous world of dance. programme.title: Alphas
programme.desc: Cameron almost relapses to alcoholism after receiving news that his ex-wife is moving back to Nevada. Instead, he attends an AA meeting, where he encounters a mysterious man who offers to ease his pain at a weekend retreat in Connecticut. However, the stranger turns out to be an Alpha capable of inducing a state of bliss in others, and Rosen discovers he is using his powers to amass a cult of followers. Guest starring Garret Dillahunt (Raising Hope)

programme.title: Motorway Patrol
programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. The series is centred around the roads of Auckland, the country's largest urban area, and features motoring chaos including major traffic collisions, escaped animals and pedestrians on busy roads. There is also footage of drivers falling asleep at the wheel, overloaded vehicles and suspects caught with illegal substances - plus a host of excuses as the people pulled over try to persuade officers they have not done anything wrong

programme.title: Shine On Harvey Moon
programme.desc: An RAF clerk returns from the war to find his house in ruins - destroyed not by German bombs, but by his wife forgetting to turn off the gas

programme.title: Shine On Harvey Moon
programme.desc: Harvey finds reacquainting himself with his estranged son is not as easy as he initially thought

programme.title: My Greek Odyssey
programme.desc: A journey through some of the most spectacular and unique Greek islands, exploring the rich culture, history and food of Greece while meeting the locals and those who live there

programme.title: The Baron
programme.desc: Having received a tip-off that the Lynstead art collection is about to be burgled, Mannering lies in wait with the police for the thieves

programme.title: The Prisoner
programme.desc: Number Six suffers an identity crisis as Number Two tries to convince him he is someone else, bringing a double into the Village in an attempt to crack him. Guest starring Jane Merrow and Anton Rodgers

programme.title: The Avengers
programme.desc: On the way to a party at an air base, the team's car crashes and Steed is knocked out. Upon regaining consciousness, however, it appears he has gone back in time. Starring Patrick Macnee and Diana Rigg

programme.title: Dear John
programme.desc: An ordinary schoolteacher arrives home to find his wife has left him. Bittersweet sitcom, starring Ralph Bates

programme.title: The Fall and Rise of Reginald Perrin
programme.desc: Perrin Products and Grot go from strength to strength, but before long things get out of hand. Comedy, starring Leonard Rossiter

programme.title: Secrets of London with Mark Monroe
programme.desc: London cabbie Mark Monroe takes you to the hidden and more quirky parts of this amazing city that normally lie undiscovered.

programme.title: The 14 (1973)
programme.desc: A mother of 14 falls ill, and her children struggle to support the family themselves. Drama, starring Jack Wild, Alun Armstrong and June Brown

programme.title: On the Fiddle (1961)
programme.desc: A Second World War black marketeer is arrested, but a judge forces him to join the army rather than sending him to prison. He soon finds a willing accomplice in an easy-going fellow recruit, and together they concoct a variety of underhanded schemes to avoid being sent to the front line. Comedy based on RF Delderfield's novel, starring Alfred Lynch and Sean Connery

programme.title: The Lion Queen
programme.desc: Andi struggles to recover from having to sell four lions. A scientist reveals the results of a recent study into wild lion genetics which forces Andi to question whether she's doing the right thing at Glen Garriff

programme.title: London Live News
programme.desc: News weather events and the best of the capital's culture. Join us to explore life in London.

programme.title: Auschwitz in 33 Objects
programme.desc: Discover the stories behind the personal items and belongings left behind in Auschwitz Birkenau, a former nazi concentration and extermination camp, the world's largest cemetery and resting place. Part 4 of 5.

programme.title: Wild Britain with Ray Mears
programme.desc: The survival expert explores the South Downs, starting from Beachy Head, and examines some of the 39 species of butterfly recorded as using its chalk downlands as a habitat, including the Adonis blue. He also visits the supposedly haunted yew woodland at Kingley Vale nature reserve in West Sussex and comes across peregrine falcons and badgers

programme.title: Top Tens of Warfare
programme.desc: An insight into the 20th century's most significant ships, submarines and other naval vessels, featuring the likes of the German U-Boat, the Nimitz Aircraft Carriers and D-Day's landing craft

programme.title: When Missing Turns to Murder
programme.desc: Series in which families reveal the moment their lives changed forever - when they were told their missing loved ones had been murdered

programme.title: Screen Two
programme.desc: Fact-based drama, starring Lynn Redgrave as a mother who took on the British legal establishment when no prosecutions followed the drug-related unlawful killing of her son

programme.title: Eden Lake (2008)
programme.desc: A couple on a romantic break find their peace shattered by a gang of youths who steal their belongings and vandalise their car. However, when they confront the youngsters they are subjected to a horrific attack, resulting in a deadly game of cat and mouse through the woodland. Horror, starring Kelly Reilly and Michael Fassbender

programme.title: The Immortalists
programme.desc: Documentary following two biologists as they try to discover what the world would be like if people did not age, and if such a thing is either possible or desirable

programme.title: Park
programme.desc: Documentary exploring what goes on in urban parks that local residents do not see

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing lesser known areas of London for locals and tourists. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: Secrets of London with Mark Monroe
programme.desc: London cabbie Mark Munroe takes you to the hidden and more quirky parts of this amazing city that normally lie undiscovered

programme.desc: Having received a tip-off that the Lynstead art collection is about to be burgled, Mannering lies in wait with the police for the thieves

programme.title: Shine On Harvey Moon
programme.desc: Harvey continues to come to terms with life after returning home from the RAF

programme.title: Shine On Harvey Moon
programme.desc: Former football professional Harvey endeavours to rebuild his chaotic life. Comedy starring Kenneth Cranham

programme.title: My Greek Odyssey
programme.desc: Peter Maneas journeys through some of the most spectacular Greek islands, exploring the rich culture, history and food of Greece while meeting the locals and those who live there

programme.title: The Baron
programme.desc: While searching for a missing crate of valuable antiques, Cordelia discovers a murder and is promptly abducted by the killer

programme.title: The Prisoner
programme.desc: Number Six strives to discover the identity of the mysterious figure behind the craze for accelerated learning sweeping the Village, to prove that knowledge does not equal wisdom. Vintage drama series, starring Patrick McGoohan

programme.title: Grand Tours of the Scottish Islands
programme.desc: Paul Murton crosses the great natural harbour of Scapa Flow to the island of Flotta, before heading round the main Island of Orkney to Stronsay and on to the stunning beaches of Sanday. Along the way, he hears stories of the First World War, a mysterious beast and Orkney's selkies

programme.title: Grand Tours of the Scottish Islands
programme.desc: Paul Murton embarks on his most difficult journey to date as every destination has been long abandoned by people, meaning there are no ferries, piers or proper landing stages. He visits the once-inhabited island of Heisgeir, sails around the gannet haven of Sula Sgeir and endures rough seas to make landfall on the extraordinarily remote island of North Rona

programme.title: Monkey
programme.desc: The quartet's progress is halted by a series of volcanoes, and only a fan from the Queen of Fire will allow them to pass. Unfortunately, she is now a recluse, so the pilgrims have their work cut out convincing her to part with it

programme.title: Space 1999
programme.desc: The Dorcans, a powerful alien race, demand the Alphans hand Maya over to them. Last ever episode of the sci-fi adventure, starring Martin Landau and Patrick Troughton

programme.title: Lost in the Stars (1974)
programme.desc: A black South African minister searching the unfamiliar back alleys and shantytowns of Johannesburg for his missing son. Musical drama, starring Brock Peters and Melba Moore

programme.title: Tomorrow We Live (1943)
programme.desc: The mayor of a small town in occupied France collaborates with the Nazis, but does not realise his daughter is working with the Resistance. She offers shelter to an idealistic fugitive travelling without identification papers, who helps the rebels with smuggling Allied airmen into Britain. Second World War adventure, starring John Clements and Greta Gynt

programme.title: The Avengers
programme.desc: On the way to a party at an air base, the team's car crashes and Steed is knocked out. Upon regaining consciousness, however, it appears he has gone back in time. Starring Patrick Macnee and Diana Rigg

programme.title: Listen (2020)

Their seven-year-old daughter's deafness triggers a process in the system that seems to go on forever. Drama, starring Lcia Moniz and Sophia Myles

programme.title: Big Boys Don't Cry (2020)
programme.desc: A man recalls his harrowing childhood growing up in a children's home following a police investigation into his boyhood friend's suicide. Drama, starring Michael Socha

programme.title: Honour (2014)
programme.desc: A Muslim girl is forbidden from seeing her boyfriend by her traditional parents, but she defies them and the couple run away together. Thriller, starring Paddy Considine and Aiysha Hart

programme.title: Little Matters: Turtles
programme.desc: Turtles are slow, calm, gentle creatures - but not always

programme.title: Griff's Great Australian Adventure
programme.desc: Riding an historic Tiger Moth bi-plane, Griff Rhys Jones arrives in the humid tropics of Darwin. He encounters a crocodile and an iconic news editor, before travelling through the night on a road train, arriving in the 'red centre' of Alice Springs - only to be surprised by the lush green sporting fields and the mysterious Americans playing baseball there. The presenter gets some tips on how to survive in the desert from an Aboriginal elder, before riding into the sunset on a camel - in tribute to the Afghan cameleers for which the legendary Ghan passenger train is named

programme.title: Screen Two
programme.desc: Fact-based drama, starring Lynn Redgrave as a mother who took on the British legal establishment when no prosecutions followed the drug-related unlawful killing of her son

programme.title: Song for a Raggy Boy (2003)
programme.desc: A widower is hired to teach at a strict Catholic reformatory school, but the harsh regime soon fires his anger, leading to a series of confrontations with the heavy-handed priests in charge of the establishment. Fact-based drama set in 1939, starring Aidan Quinn, Iain Glen, Marc Warren and Dudley Sutton

programme.title: Eden Lake (2008)
programme.desc: A couple on a romantic break find their peace shattered by a gang of youths who steal their belongings and vandalise their car. However, when they confront the youngsters they are subjected to a horrific attack, resulting in a deadly game of cat and mouse through the woodland. Horror, starring Kelly Reilly and Michael Fassbender

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing lesser known areas of London for locals and tourists. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: Blackonomics
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the UK's Afro-Caribbean community's relationship with money when it comes to education, investing and building general wealth

programme.title: News Rewind
programme.desc: A digest of news and events from across London from the past few days.

programme.title: Talking Points
programme.desc: 'Current affairs affecting Londoners today and a look at the latest shows and films in the capital.

programme.desc: Live coverage of day two from Billie Jean King National Tennis Centre at Flushing Meadows in New York, featuring matches in the first round. Two-time champion and WTA Tour veteran of 20 years, Venus Williams, was eliminated at the first time of asking 12 months ago when she was defeated 6-1, 7-6 by Alison Van Uytvanck, while another two-time champion, Naomi Osaka, also made an early exit following a 7-6, 6-3 loss to 19th seed Danielle Collins

programme.title: Live DP World Tour Golf
programme.desc: The Omega European Masters. Live coverage of day one from Crans-sur-Sierre Golf Club in Switzerland. South Africa's Thriston Lawrence will be looking to defend the title that he won last year, while England's Matthew Fitzpatrick is aiming to win this competition for the third time in his career. Other winners of this tournament include Sergio Garcia, Danny Willett and Ernie Els

programme.title: Live US Open Tennis
programme.desc: Live coverage of day four from Billie Jean King National Tennis Centre at Flushing Meadows in New York, featuring matches in the second round. World number one Iga Swiatek prevailed 6-3, 6-2 against 2017 champion Sloane Stephens en route to the title at this stage last year, and Jessica Pegula was also a straight-sets winner against Aliaksandra Sasnovich. In the men's competition, eventual champion Carlos Alcaraz won 6-1, 6-2, 7-5 against Federico Coria, and his Spanish compatriot Rafael Nadal came back from a set down to eliminate Fabio Fognini
